description: The Cadillac circled the block of the St. George Tower Apartments in Brooklyn Heights, crowded with a sign artist, a public relat?? woman, a builder, his interior designer, and Hank Sopher ??l of whom were gathered to find the right place to put the J ??i Sopher & Co. sign.

title: Editors' Choice
description: THE BASS SAXOPHONE, by Josef Skvorecky. (Knopf, $8.95.) Two novellas about life in Communist Czechoslovakia, resonant with political, romantic and musical undertones.

title: Deaths
description: AXELRADAlexander. On February 13. beloved husband of the late Florence Axelrad. Devoted lather of Card and Donald Loving grandfather and brother. Interment San Fernando, California.

title: Many Factions Begin the Real Struggle for Power
description: TEHERAN, Iran  When leftist guerrillas of the People's Fedayeen invaded the Intercontinental Hotel in Teheran last week, they announced its occupation in the name of Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini. A blackrobed ayatollah arrived soon after to plead with them to leave in the name of Avntotinh Khomeini. A few hours later, a new group of Is lamic warriors took up posts to defend the hotel, again invoking the name of Ayatollah Khomeini. Throughout the week, daily calls were issued, also in the Moslem leader's name, to return the thousands of weapons taken from army bases and police stations during the chaos following the overthrow of the government a week ago. But many factions said they were holding on to their weapons  to protect Ayatollah Khomeini's Islamic revolution.

title: Long Island/This Week
description: CENTRAL ISLIP  Oils by Helen Hoppe; A.M. to 4:30 P.M. weekdays; through February; Senior Citizens Center, Clayton St.

title: Ranger Rally Beats Flyers
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 17  The Rangers played it differently this afternoon. Instead of grabbing a lead and then losing it, they let the Philadelphia Flyers assume the burden. Then the New Yorkers rallied with four goals in the third period for a 42 victory at the Spectrum.

title: European Smog Linked to Mysterious Arctic Haze
description: GENEVA, Feb. 17  Smog and dust from industrial Europe and China may account for a mysterious haze that hangs over Alaska, Greenland and the Arctic Ocean every spring, according to analysis of atmospheric particles that are assumed to cause the haze.

title: Robin S. Oury Sets Wedding
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert E. Oury of Cincinnati have made known the engagement of their daughter, Robin Sue. Oury, to Peter Wilkens Hursh, son of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Devers Hursh of Darien,. Conn. A June 9 wedding is planned.

title: NUMISMATICS
description: What is probably the finest example of our very first type of silver dollar, the 1794 Flowing Hair Liberty, is being offered by the Bowers & Ruddy Galleries of California. This coin is a gem svecimen of the piece that was set aside back in October of 1794 by Henry Voigt, the chief coiner of the Mint. A year later it was acquired as a souvenir by Major Lord St. Oswald on his visit to America.

title: Air Force Reports a Morale Loss As Result of Efforts to Save Fuel
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (Reuters) Efforts by the Air Force to save fuel has resulted in such a big reduction in flight training time that the capability and morale of pilots have been affected, according to John Stetson, the Secretary of the Air Force.

title: Unknown Violinist Unknown No More
description: HAPPINESS in the music business is signing a relatively unknown artist two years in advance of a performance and having him win a major international competition in the meantime.

title: WILLIAM GARGAN, 73, STAGE AND TV ACTOR
description: William D. Gargan, an actor known for his tough detective, sergeant and worker roles on stage and screen, died yesterday of a heart attack aboard a commercial airline flight from New York to San Diego. He was 73 years old.

title: GALLERY VIEW
description: T o talk in terms of decades is great nonsense, in almost all the ways that really matter. Our traditional summations of the 1920's, the 30's and the 40's  to name three examples only  have at best a rudimentary usefulness.

title: Mexico Oil Output Is Called 2 Years Ahead of Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  President Jos Lpez Portillo of Mexico told President Carter this week that Mexican oil production was rising much fester than expected, officials of the Carter Administration said here today.

title: Other Regional Events
description: Community fears have been rising so New Jersey health officials began testing 55 people last week for mercury poisoning near a 36yearold dump in WoodRidge. The test area was a 4,000foot section of about 60 homes and a few factories. The defunct WoodRidge Chemical Corporation, which processed mercury and its byproducts until it was torn down in 1974, had been within the area. Health officials said it would be a month before results are known.

title: Newark's Haitians: Troubled Transition
description: NEWARK SOME 99,000 Haitians reside here, but they tend to remain aloof from social and political involvement, frustrated by cultural and language barriers and the troubling fact that about 12 percent of them have entered the United States illegally.

title: Sports Today
description: AUTO RACING

title: Macal Leads Symphony of Hamburg
description: It was a nice, conventional program that Zdenek Macal and the Symphony of Hamburg brought to Carnegie Hall Friday night. Even the last piece, Hindemith's Symphonic Metamorphoses on Themes by Weber, is one of his lightweight works and has developed into a repertory work  one of Hindemith's few, alas. Otherwise there were Mozart's Haffner Symphony, the Rachmaninoff Piano Concerto No. 2, played by Jorge Bolet, and Richard Strauss's Don Juan.

title: This Week in Sports
description: The Daytona 500 stockcar race, with Cale Yarborough, Bobby Allison and Richard Petty, will be run today in Daytona Beach, Fla. Next Sunday's race will be the Richmond (Va.) 400.

title: Susan Bacon Plans a June Bridal
description: Robert Bacon of Woods Hole, Mass., and Katharine Jay Bacon of Cambridge, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Susan Bacon, to Henry Cabot Lodge 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. George Cabot Lodge of Beverly, Mass. A June wedding is Warmed.

title: High C's and High Jinks in Manhasset
description: MANHASSET SIX persons staggered around a rehearsal room in the Ansonia Hotel in New York, clutching their heads and singing of chaos and confusion.

title: Yankees: Ready for Dull Run Toward Another Series
description: The Yankees have been in spring training for a week, and neither the owner and the manager nor the manager and the right fielder have had a fight.

title: Authors Queries
description: For an authorized edition of the correspondence of Carl Van Vechten, American novelist, critic and photographer, I would appreciate copies of letters in private collections.

title: Strikers in Iran Heeding Plea to Return to Their Jobs
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 17  Responding to an appeal by Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, merchants, shopkeepers, office workers and others returned to their jobs in the capital today, ending some of the walkouts that had undermined the Government of Shah Mohammed Riza Pahlevi.

title: Meadowlands Rift Impeding Progress
description: SECAUCUS ARIFT between the Hackensack Meadowlands Development Commission and the mayors of the 14 communities that own the property appears to be hampering continued development of the huge marshland.

title: CHILDREN'S BOOKS
description: I am an ardent fan of the affectionate detail and colorwashed charm of the artist Peter Spier's Mother Goose Library, books in which nurseryrhyme characters turn up in

title: A Classic Military Operation
description: The Chinese invasion of Vietnam followed, at the outset, the classic pattern of attacks over a wide front  with the defenders left guessing about the principal axis of advance.

title: This Is a Job for Supersavvy
description: WHEN I was a pigtailed schoolgirl, my real name was Lois Lane. Ordinary objects and events shimmered with inherent catastrophe. Erasers clapping together released clouds of lethal gas. The soda jerk who prepared my Saturday morning maltedmilk fix was Strange Stanley, Master Crook. With a snap of an eyeball, he could hypnotize the unwary  and fearless reporters  who revived in his sewer kingdom in chains.

title: Vance vs. Brzezinski Oversimplifies BuiltIn Conflicts
description: WASHINGTON  President Carter's open Administration seemed to become a little more closed last week when he told a press conference that he expected aides to support his foreign policy decisions with loyalty and enthusiasm. Mr. Carter. unhappy over the publicity given to internal criticism of the Administration's policies in the Iranian crisis, said it was not always appropriate for Government officials to comment on policy.

title: Questions/Answers
description: What is the difference between the yam and the sweet potato? Mrs. F.B., Clifton, N.J.

title: Koch Formally Opens Brooklyn Supermarket
description: A 30,000squarefoot supermarket, the largest to be established in the BedfordStuyvesant section of Brooklyn in more than two decades, was formally opened yesterday by Mayor Koch.

title: Dog Show Calendar
description: Today  First Company Foot Guard Athletic Association allbreed and obedience, Civic Center, Hartford; 1,200 dogs 9 A.M.

title: River Town in Idaho Opposes Plan by U.S. To Give It New Bridge
description: LEWISTON, Idaho, Feb. 17  Officials of this Idaho panhandle town of about 26,000 people are doing everything they can to refuse the Coast Guard's effort to give it $25 million to build a new bridge over the Clearwater River. But the Coast Guard may force the town to accept the 11 free money.

title: Toll in Explosion in Warsaw Bank Rises to 44 Dead and 110 Injured
description: WARSAW, Feb. 17 (AP)  The death toll from a mysterious blast in a crowded Warsaw savings bank has risen to 44, the official Polish press agency reported today.

title: An amusementpark carrousel rides to national distinction.
description: NUTMEGGERS who do not plan to make the trip next week to Montana, where the darkness will be total, can enjoy the continent's last solar eclipse of this century right here on Feb. 26, according to the Mystic Seaport Museum Planetarium.

title: ABOUT CARS
description: Q. I JUST purchased a 1979 Chevette without undercoating, primarily because I have read that undercoating, although good as sound insulation, is not effective as a rustproofing measure, which is what I want. A few of my friends have told me that I should have had the undercoating. Who is right and why? JOSEPH RIGBY Mount Vernon, N.Y.

title: Christine A. Belson Wed to R.B. Smart
description: St. Thomas Episcopal Church in Battle Creek, Mich., was the setting yesterday morning for the marriage of Christine Ann Belson, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Gordon A. Belson of Battle Creek, to Robert B. Smart of Amherst, N.H., son of Mr. and Mrs. William R. Smart of Wayzata, Minn., formerly of Darien, Conn. The ceremony was performed by Canon Charles P. James, who was assisted by the Rev. William C. McMorran of Ashburn, Va.

title: Nancy E. Lee Engaged To Warren G. King 3d
description: Mrs. Robert Fetter Lee of Cleveland has announced the engagement of her daughter, Nancy Ellen Lee, to Warren Griffin King 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. King Jr. of Willoughby, Ohio, and Key Largo, Fla. A June wedding at the Fairmount Presbyterian Church in Cleveland Heights, Ohio, is planned.

title: U.S. Publishers Press Cause of Soviet Writer
description: Despite the deemphasis on human rights initiatives by Washington, American publishers are taking up the cause of Mykola D. Rudenko, the most prominent Soviet writer in prison, in an attempt to persuade their publishing counterparts in Moscow to use their influence to free him.

title: Pearson Winner, Loser
description: Billy Pearson, who has a lot of running talent but doesn't always use it to his best advantage, gave the spectators a sample of both yesterday at the Brooklyn and Queens Public Schools Athletic League indoor borough championships in the 102d Engineers Armory.

title: Powerful Figure In Brazil Moves Out of Shadows
description: BRASILIA  When Brazil's armed forces deposed a weak civilian government 15 years ago, they adopted a style of institutional military rule that looked down upon the personalism of earlier phases of uniformed rule here and in other countries.

title: Dagni Belgum Wed To Martin L. Senzel
description: Dagni Maren Belgum and Martin Lee Senzel were married yesterday at the St. Moritz Hotel by Justice Myles Lane of the State Supreme Court.

title: Split Over Bank Profits Guidelines
description: The net cast by the Administration's inflation fighters allows many a big fish to slip through: The wage and price guidelines aren't applicable to meat and produce, for instance, nor to imported products such as oil. Last week there were strong indications that one of the big fish  the banking industry  would be allowed to swim freely.

title: Times Raising OutofTown Price
description: The New York Times will raise the suggested newsstand price of its Sunday issue outside a 50mile radius of New York City to $1.10 from $1, starting with the issue of March 4, 1979. The price will remain higher in cities that receive the newspaper by air freight. The higher price has been made necessary by increased transportation costs. The last time the price of the Sunday issue was raised in the national area was on Sept. 1, 1974, when it went to $1 from 90 cents.

title: Headliners
description: Head of the Church of England she may be, but to conduct her current ceremonial visit to the Middle East, Queen Elizabeth II has been accorded by her hosts a distinction denied her forbears: they have made her an honorary man. Only a man, it seems, can be a chief of state in the strict Moslem countries bordering the Persian Gulf. The Queen is a chief of state. Q.E.D. Further to satisfy Islamic notions of propriety, the Queen is said to be prepared with scarves attached to her hats so she can cover her face.

title: The U.S. Gets Deeper in Debt to Foreigners
description: WASHINGTON  Foreigners  central banks as well as wealthy private investors and corporations  have become this country's largest single creditor, largely through actions taken to bolster the American dollar and because the growing United States payments deficit has allowed billions of dollars to flow overseas.

title: 15,118 See Notre Dame Beat West Virginia
description: MORGANTOWN, W. Va., Feb. 17 (AP)  Notre Dame, sparked by Bill Hanzlik's 14 points, overcame a 3point halftime deficit, and the largest basketball crowd in West Virginia history  15,118  tonight watched the Fighting Irish defeat West Virginia University, 7054.Special to The New York Times

title: STAGE VIEW
description: One of the nicest moments in They're Playitig Our Song (one of the few nicest moments, I'm sorry to say) turns up while our hero and pop composa, Robert Klein, is all trundled up in a hospital bed. One leg is in a cast because he's attempted to cross a Los Angeles street while the lights said Walk. (No, I don't think that's quite funny enough; it's the sort of joke you make with one hand tied behind your back, or perhaps one foot in a cast.) Anyway, when Lucie Arnaz, as the lyricwriting girl he loves, puts in her prettyasapicture appearance at his bedside, she brings him a tiny red piano. (We'll skip the jokes about the piano for the moment.) And, after she's gone, Mr. Klein moved to use the very few keys at his disposal to tinkle out an incomplete tune called Fill in the Words. That's to say, he completes melody and lyric but leaves just four or five notes wide open on that miniature instrument in his lap, the purpose of the gap being to let everyone say I love you his own inadequate way.

title: Deaths
description: SUCHANEK  Joseph J., suddenly on Feb 16, 1979, beloved brother of Charles, Elsie Lang, Mary Beach and Emily PaIka. Friends may call at The Abbey, Madison Ave at 81 St on Sunday and Monday from 2 to 5 and 7 to 9PM. Funeral Mass, Church of Our Lady of Perpetual Help, 323 E. 61 St on Tuesday at 10AM.

title: At St. Mopritz, Aristocrats On Sleds
description: ST. MORITZ, Switzerland  The irresistible combination of high society and dangerous sport still draws people here despite the fading glamour of this now demode village.

title: Soviet Denies Advisers in Kabul Had Role in U.S. Envoy's Death
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 17  The Soviet Union denied today that its police advisers in Afghanistan supervised an assault Wednesday against abductors of the American Ambassador, Adolph Dubs, after which the Ambassador was found riaari of bullet wounds.

title: National Fuel Gas Asks Increase Of 7% for Its Clients in New York
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 16 (AP)  National Fuel Gas filed a request today with the New York State Public Service Commission for a 7 percent rate increase.

title: Civilization Vs. Culture
description: AVIDJONES, the author of In Parenthesis, the most monumental work of poetic genius to come out of World War I, and of the greatly admired Anathemata, left behind a mass of papers when he died in 1974. Collected here under the title The Dying Gaul, they

title: The Mentally Ill: Does Anyone Care?
description: EAST ORANGE MENTALHEALTH care is a sort of Catch22 situation in New Jersey, according to Dr. William Furst, president of the Community Psychiatric Institute, a nonprofit facility in this Essex County town.

title: Let's Go! And the Dog Sleds Race Off
description: RIDGE FORGET all that stuff about drivers draped in caribou skins yelling mush, mush at a team of huskies as they make their way across the desolate tundra. Dogsledding is no longer the sole province of Admiral Peary types.

title: SPORTS
description: THE best way to teach babies how to swim, some people say, is to throw them into the water. The best way to keep elderly people from fading away, they are also saying, is to lure them near the water and Rive them a push. Taken literally, of course, such advice could lead to trouble, but for the last 10 years or so, Connecticut's oldies (in this case anyone over 25) have been figuratively pushing each other into the pool, often enough to make the Amateur Athletic Union take notice.

title: Tharp Dancers Present Eight Jelly Rolls and Hen
description: Twyla Tharp's dance is a feast of parts that combine to produce dazzling apparent disarray. It is all carefully ordered chaos, however, spun out by an edgy intelligence and executed by some of the most quietly highpowered dancers around these days. On Friday at the

title: Saudis Free Britons To Honor Queen's Trip
description: BAHRAIN, Feb. 17 (Reuters)  Queen Elizabeth II left today for Saudi Arabia on the third leg of a threeweek tour of Persian Gulf nations. British officials said she would be wearing anklelength clothes in deference to Islamic custom.

title: Day Care Moves Up From Poverty
description: HE stereotype that day care is primarily for the children of needy mothers is changing. As middleclass women in Westchester enter the work force in ever larger numbers, they are finding increasing need for such centers to accommodate their children, and that means not only that the centers are expanding, but also their image.

title: Berkshire Paper Plans Switch
description: PITTSFIELD, Mass., Feb. 17 (AP) The Berkshire Eagle, an afternoon daily since 1892, will switch to sixdayaweek morning publication this spring, its editor and publisher, Lawrence K. Miller, has announced. The Pittsfieldbased newspaper, with a circulation of 30,000, now publishes Monday through Friday afternoons and Saturday morning.

title: The Case for
description: Face it, theatergoers just aren't taking to the modern school of drama  astringent, stylized plays that have no stories or characters or feelings. Today's theatergoers want sentiment, compassion and emotion, and they are right to want these qualities in the Theater. We respect Harold Pinter's plays. They are brilliant. But we don't love them. In a recent survey in these pages asking playwrights to choose the most perfect plays, the work of Pinter, Beckett and the absurdists was all but ignored. A few years ago, Beckett and Pinter were the most admired playwrights of their time, especially among other playwrights, leading the movement toward the cool play set in a detached reality. But now, it would seem, the playwrights are beginning to agree with theatergoers, in recognizing that some human contact is needed in the theater. How else can one explain so many writers turning their backs on the absurdism that has dominated drama for so long?

title: J.A.. Bloom Fianc Of Roberta F. Lorn
description: Dr. and Mrs. Walter S. Lorn of Brooklyn have announced the engagement of their daughter, Roberta Fran Lorn, to Jeremy Alan Bloom, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Bloom of Levittown, Pa.

title: WESTCHESTER HOUSING
description: THE fireplace, the wall of windows, the massive wooden front door  all are going out of style, their use banned or limited by the state.

title: Charity Groups In Bitter Feud
description: WHITE PLAINS THE United Way of Westchester has become locked in a bitter feud with the Westchester Community Services Council over its decision to cut off the Council's funds. The combinedcharities organization, which has moved from its traditional fundraising and disbursing role to the planning and coordination of community services, contends that the Council's planning operations and productivity are inadequate.

title: State Details Cuts
description: WASHINGTON LOCAL governments in Connecticut will receive $40 million less from five major Federal financing programs in 1980 than this year, according to a state analysis of President Carter's proposed 1980 budget.

title: Syracuse Conquers St. John's
description: SYRACUSE, Feb. 17  This Syracuse team has more tools than the Syracuse team that went to the final four of the nationals at San Diego four years ago.

title: DINING OUT
description: AMONG the many restaurants along Route 32, on the Pennsylvania side of the Delaware River north of New Hope, the Jason House in Upper Black Eddy is full of the unexpected for searchers in quest of fine wines and French cuisine. Who would expect to find, on a windy hilltop overlooking both Upper Black Eddy and Milford a bit of PariscumNew York?

title: ART
description: LINCROFT GOTHIC short stories and novels have produced their share of nightmarish characters. Some very weird and sinister creatures also have emerged from sciencefiction movies. as well as from other forms of visual art.

title: Arts and Leisure Guide
description: Opening This Week

title: GirI, 15, Indicted on Rape
description: ROCHESTER, Feb. 16 (UPI)  A 15yearold believed to be the first girl to face rape charges under New York's new juvenile crime law has pleaded not guilty to charges she sexually attacked a 14yearold girl. The suspect, Jacqueline Johnson, is being held on $10,000 bail on an indictment charging her with firstdegree rape. Women have been charged with rape only three other times in New York.

title: Italian Police Captain Slain
description: IMOLA, Italy, Feb. 17 (Reuters) Giuseppe Pulicari, 45 years old, a police captain, was shot dead today as he lay waiting for blackmailers under a highway bridge near this north Italian town, the police said. Two men were later arrested and one, held after he went to hospital with bullet wounds, was charged with murder and attempted blackmail.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: Evergreens can be safely pruned now, but caution on pruning the socalled bleeder trees  maples, beech, dogwood and sycamore; postpone their pruning until midsummer when the sap will not run excessively. ... If geraniums are overgrown and floppy, cut bock the succulent shoots and root them; they should be large enough to set outside in May. ... Check succulents and cacti often for mealybugs which hide in leaf joints; wipe them out with a cotton swab dipped in rubbing alcohol. Check the plants every few days.

title: Iranian Premier Talks of Resuming Oil Sale to U.S. as Soon as Possible
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 17  Prime Minister Medhi Bazargan said today that Iran's new revolutionary Government intended to resume oil exports as soon as possible to all parts of the world, including the United States, and was eager to maintain good relations with Washington.

title: Neediest Cases Fund Drive Surpasses Previous Record
description: Donations to The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund reached $1,090,567.08, a record, last week, surpassing the previous record of $1,069,034.03 received in the 1976 appeal. Yesterday alone, $40,000 was recorded.

title: Tombstones Designed To Show Trademarks Of People They Honor
description: CHARLESTON, Ill. (AP)  Wendell Adams and Dale Lawyer use their artistry to design and produce tombstones that preserve the trademark of the people who lie beneath them.

title: Arson Fight Heats Up
description: NEW HAVEN I THINK the word is out on the streets now that if you burn in New Haven, we're going to look into it and we're going to seriously investigate it.

title: Please Don't Call It Persia
description: THERE'S a scene in Identity Card, by the Iranian novelist F.M. Esfandiary, in which an American and an Iranian meet at a party in Teheran. Let me tell you something, the American says. Americans and Europeans don't know how live. Here it is different, people don't rush all the time,

title: Senate of Massachusetts Sets 19 as Drinking Age
description: BOSTON, Feb. 17 (AP)  The State Senate has voted to raise Massachusetts's legal drinking age only to 19 years, not the minimum of 21 endorsed by the House.

title: Paperbacks: New and Noteworthy
description: DEAR ME, by Peter Ustinov. (Penguin. $2.95.) The Britishborn actor, film director, playwright and novelist recalls his entertaining experiences and colorful colleagues in London, New York and Hollywood. An unusually graceful memoir, our reviewer John Lahr described it, whose wit bears witness to its author's generosity and seriousness.

title: Women: New Facet of the Diamond Trade
description: What is so rare as a woman in the diamond trade? Females have long been excluded from the business of polishing and dealing in the stones  not only by the traditions and centuriesold laws of Eastern European Hasidic Jews who dominate the industry  but by outright regulations of the elite clubs of the trade. But recently the walls of the dealers' tightlyknit community opened a crack, with two decisions that could have worldwide repercussions in the industry: the New York Diamond Dealers Club opened its membership to women and the Antwerp bourse approved the participation of a woman buyer.

title: A Senator and His Party Boss At Loggerheads in Connecticut
description: HARTFORD  The morale of Connecticut Republicans, who haven't quite recovered from the disaster of last November's election, hasn't been helped a bit by the potshots exchanged this month by two of their party's most prominent figures, Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., the only Republican holding office with a statewide constituency, and the party's state chairman, Frederick K. Biebel.

title: A Day in the Life of Probate Court
description: WHITE PLAINS THE scene in the probate department of Surrogate's Court was a familiar one  a lawyer sitting patiently at the desk of Adolph C. Peterka, the probate clerk, while Mr. Peterka examined a will being submitted for validation.

title: Weinbuch Heads Skiers
description: STE. ANNE DE BEAUPRE, Quebec, Feb. 17 (AP) Hermann Weinbuch of West Germany finished 13th in a 10kilometer crosscountry segment combined event at the world junior Nordic ski championships today. Wein buch, 18 years old, had a time of 35 minutes 1.41 seconds for 184.77 points under a complicated International Ski Federation rating system that gives the winner 220 points and other skiers fewer based on their time relative to the winner. Uwe Dotzauer of East Germany won the crosscountry race in 32:05.24. He had been only 12th in the jumping competition that opened the twoday combined event yesterday and was fourth over all.

title: Miss Rosenstiel, And J.H. Kabler 3d, Lawyer, Are Wed
description: Elizabeth Carol Rosenstiel, dater of Its. Walter H.,Annenberg and the late Lewis S., Rosenstiel, founder and chairman of Schenley Industries, was married yesterday. to James Harvey Kabler 3d, Son of Mr. Kabler Jr. of Sindbridge Beach, Va., Ana Kay Ullasity Kabler of Norfolk; Va. The Rev. John C. Harper Jr., rector of St. John's Episcopal Church at Lafayette Square in, Washington, performed the ceremony at Sunnylands, the Annenberg winter homein Rancho Mirage, Calif.

title: Peril to Humanity Seen In Loss of Forest Lands
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (AP)  The world's forests are disappearing at an alarming rate, a loss that poses potentially dire economic and environmental problems for most of humanity, a new study concludes.

title: Marriage Announcement 6  No Title
description: Robin J. Blacklow Is Betrothed

title: DINING OUT
description: TO judge from the relaxed comfort of the place, the consistently high level of the cooking and the gracious service, one might guess that Gene LaSalle's Restaurant had been installed in Great Neck for several years instead of merely a few months. Any rough edges were obviously sanded off before the carpenters left.

title: ABOUT CARS
description: Q. I JUST purchased a 1979 Chevette without undercoating, primarily because I have read that undercoating, although good as sound insulation, is not effective as a rustproofing measure, which is what I want. A few of my friends have told me that 1 should have had the undercoating. Who is right and why? JOSEPH RIGBY Mount Vernon, N.Y.

title: Connecticut/This Week
description: AVON  Veils, solo show by Lucia Haskell McBee. Environmental treatment of dyed fabric and light. Farmington Valley Art Center, through March 3. Tuesday through Saturday 11 to 4, Sunday 1 to 4. 6781867.

title: GoGetting GoBetween
description: JEAN MONNET is the outstandingly creative European statesman of our times, and although he has just turned 90 he is hardly known as a personality at all. Apart from a handful of postgraduates studying modern history, who knows about him in America?

title: LETTERS TO THE NEW JERSEY EDITOR
description: The high price of houses is just one of the many complex problems contributing to our inflationary woes. Where housing is concerned, people artmostly divided into two classes: Those on the inside and those pressing their noses against the glass, wishing they could get in.

title: MAIL SERVICE CHIEF FORESEES SOLVENCY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  It was born again in 1970. The Post Office Department became the Postal Service, but it did not seem to flourish in its second life. Losing money, the mail service required increasing amounts of Federal funds to balance its books.

title: Marriage Announcement 2  No Title
description: Eileen Heslin to Be Married

title: The World Of Darvon
description: Propoxyphene is a mildtomoderate analgesic, or painkiller, that affects the central nervous system. The Darvon brand of propoxyphene sold by Eli Lilly & Company accounts for 95 percent of all propoxyphene sales in the United States and is available either as pure propoxyphene or mixed with other analgesics.

title: On Language
description: How do you do. This is a new column about language. Not about anything as grandiose as interpersonal communication nor as prescriptive as Fowler's Modern English Usage, but about new words, vogue phrases and the intriguing roots of everyday discourse  with occasionally crotchety observations on everything from proper usage to impropaganda.

title: Last Week, the American Bar Association Abandoned a Policy That Had Aged, After 70 Years
description: WASHINGTON  Seventy years ago, an article in the Harvard Law Review assessed the purpose of the juvenile justice system. The function of the juvenile court, the article said, was to take a delinquent child and find out what he is, physically, mentally, morally, and then if it learns that he is treading the path that leads to criminality, to take him in charge, not so much to punish as to reform, not to degrade but to uplift, not to crush but to develop, not to make him a criminal but a worthy citizen.

title: WASHINGTON
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 17  Like many Presidents before him, Jimmy Carter had a successful mission to Mexico. He got along well with President Jose Lopez Portillo, who is a worthy successor to a long line of distinguished LatinAmerican leaders.

title: Coast Man Released After Mixup
description: SANTA ROSA, Calif., Feb. 17 (AP) His eyes are not black, his birthday is not July 3 and his middle name is not Lee. But Richard Nance spent a month in jail before his lawyer was able to persuade the police that they had the wrong man.

title: California High Schools Getting a Surge of Iranians
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Feb. 17  The high schools of California have had a sudden influx of Iranian teenagers, in a reflection of the turmoil in the young people's disturbed home country in the Middle East.

title: CAMPAIGN GIFTS TIED TO A SENATE DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  The pitched battle over which Senate committee will process legislation on deregulation of the trucking industry is more than mere narrow inhouse bickering over Congressional turf.

title: Psychiatric Course Offers a New Approach
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 17  Glancing at the reading list for Janet Stern's class, casual observer might think that it is typical college literature course. Among the books on the list are Wuthering Heights, Frankenstein and Alice in Wonderland.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Article 1  No Title
description: The increasing likelihood of Mr. Baker's candidacy for the Republican Presidential nomination and the earlierthanexpected formation of a Presidential search committee appeared to reflect a fear on Mr. Baker's part that the 1980 campaign was getting off to a very early start.

title: Woolworth After 100 Years  More Than Just Nickels and Dimes
description: The fiveanddime  a phenomenon more typically American than any other development in retailing  remains a colloquialism today, despite the fact that the 5and10cent store, offering such items as needles, thread, candy and handkerchiefs at a price no greaterthan 10 cents, vanished in the 1930's, a victim of inflation.

title: Mary J. Scully, a Coat Buyer, Engaged to Richard J. Bauer
description: Mr. and Mrs. James Frederick Scully of Garden City, L.I., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Mary Jane Scully, to Richard Hennig Bauer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Joseph Bauer of Newburgh, N.Y. The wedding will take place next month.

title: LETTER TO THE CONNECTICUT EDITOR
description: As the author of the book Divided We Stand, which served as the basis for Andree Brooks's article, A Look at God and Man in Fairfield (Feb. 4), I would like to offer some counterbalancing comments to what some may have perceived as a very negative evaluation of either God's or man's present condition in one Connecticut suburb.

title: CONNECTICUT HOUSING
description: ALL his life Alvin Kwint of Stamford dreamed of owning his own island. In his youth as stood at the helm of his schooner while running a ferry service in the Bahamas and sometimes, as he dropped anchor at more desolate shores while fishing commercially for shark, he told himself that one day he would have a small island all his own.

title: Feldman Tightens Grip on Nomination to Oppose Klein
description: FOUR years ago, Martin J. Feldman, the Suffolk County Legislator, was denied the Democratic nomination for County Executive. Party leaders not only questioned whether Dr. Feldman could win, but also feared that he might run so poorly that he would drag other Democrats down to defeat.

title: Rival Anthropologists Divide on PreHuman Find
description: PITTSBURGH, Feb. 17  Two wellknown anthropologists challenged each other today in what could become a wideranging debate over whether a finding last month was indeed a new species of prehuman being ancestral to all other known forms of human and humanlike creatures.

title: Sporting Goods Store Is Closed, Victim of Hearst Case Publicity
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 17 (UPI) Mel's Sporting Goods store went out of business yesterday, a victim of the notoriety surrounding the Patricia Hearst case.

title: Rep. Rangel Says Subcommittee Will Stress HospitalCost Curbs
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (AP)  The Carter Administration's proposals for legislation to hold down hospital costs will be given high priority this year in the House Ways and Means Subcommittee on Health, Representative Charles B. Rangel says.

title: Pedro Beltrn, 81, ExPrime Minister of Peru, Dies
description: Pedro Gerardo Beltrn, a former Prime Minister of Peru and a strong advocate of a free press in developing countries such as his, died last Friday of heart attack in Lima. He would have been 82 years old yesterday.

title: Mechanical Problems Plague Detroit's New Buses
description: DETROIT, Feb. 17  When the city of Detroit purchased 111 new buses last summer at a cost of about $96,000 each, officials hailed the arrival of the vehicles as a major step forward in updating a deteriorating fleet of buses that had drawn the criticism of most of the city's mass transit patrons.

title: DANCE VIEW
description: All choreography appeals to the eye and the mind. But not all of it does so in the same way. Some choreography emphasizes design and pattern alone. The design represents nothing, the, patterns are abstract. This kind of choregraphy delights the eye with its beauty and pleases the mind with its intricacy.

title: Bonnie Ginzburg, Reporter, Is Engaged to Mark R. Erbe
description: Bonnie Ginzburg, a reporter with WTVT News in Tampa, Fla., and Mark Robert Erbe, who works in Tampa with the Federated Mutual Insurance Company, plan to be married in the autumn.

title: 8th Member of Delaware Family Dies From Injuries in House Fire
description: WILMINGTON, Del., Feb. 17 (AP) This city's worst fire has claimed its eighth victim, an elderly man who had offered shelter to his son's family after they were burned out of their own home earlier in the week.

title: The Cost of Research Dangers Finally Is Being Reckoned With
description: Each year several hundred thousand Americans, about 1 percent of the population, voluntarily become research subjects, allowing their bodies to be used to test everything from new cold medicines to experimental cancer treatments. Without such volunteers, medical science would collapse. Practically every drug, medical device and surgical procedure used today went through a clinical trial with human subjects. Increasingly, though, with the explosion in biomedical techniques and advances, there is growing concern about protecting human research subjects and compensating them for any injury incurred.

title: A CoatsandTies Rule Passes Senate on Coast
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Feb. 17 (UPI)  Agreeing that appearances are important, the State Senate decided yesterday that men must weal coats and ties in the Senate chambers.

title: NONFICTION IN BRIEF
description: Gerald Brenan is now in his 80's. After a long career as a writer on all matters Spanish and a memoirist and biographer of note, he has gone through his notebooks of a lifetime and culled from them thoughts and

title: City U. Needs 3 Presidents And the Search Will Be Tough
description: Such is how the ads might have run last week if truthinadvertising had made itself felt in the field of presidential searches. For the first time in a decade, all four major senior colleges of the 18unit City University system will soon have new leaders. In recent weeks, John W. Kneller and Robert E. Marshak have said they would step down as president of Brooklyn and City respectively at the end of the current academic year to return to teaching and research. Jacqueline G. Wexler has said she would leave Hunter soon as a replacement can be found, and Saul Cohen is only in his first year as president of Queens.

title: 300Pound Meteorite Found in Big Cluster On the Antarctic Ice
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17 (AP)  Scientists have discovered a group of 309 meteorites on the ice of Antarctica, including a 300pound fragment that is one of the largest yet found on the continent.

title: ExAgent, Alleging CoverUp, Sues F.B.I. Officials
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Feb. 17  A former agent of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, charging censorship of his report on probable corruption or ineffectiveness within the Indianapolis bureau, has sued three of his superiors for allegedly conspiring to cover up portions of his official report.

title: A Reunion For the Byrds
description: If I had a space ship, it would be lined with mahogany. The two coincide in my mind. Over dinner at a midtown hotel, Roger McGuinn is explaining how the Byrds, the rock band he piloted during the 1960's, were able to embrace both the antique strains of bluegrass music and the electronic sounds of the Space Age.

title: Pollution Law Faces Major Test
description: THE nation's first major test of the Resource ConserVation and Recovery Act of 1976, which is designed to remedy situations involving the disposal of hazardous wastes, will get under way Tuesday in Federal District Court in Trenton.

title: CELEBRATING EINSTEIN
description: We will always think of Albert Einstein as a possessed genius. He will always be the epitome of the absentminded professor whose genius left no room for the trivia of life. His mind was so great and so far removed from our humdrum concerns that he could dress to go out for dinner and only after reaching his host's home notice that he had forgotten his socks. He was a man who used an uncashed check as a bookmark and then lost the book; who went on a trip with a bag carefully packed by his wife and never opened it; who helped a young girl with her arithmetic and got the answers wrong; who fell out of time at an amateur music recital and was rebuked with, Einstein, can't you count?

title: The World
description: Representing the United States abroad has become a hazardous occupation. In Kabul, Afghanistan, last week. Ambassador Adolph Dubs became the fifth ambassador of the United States to lose his life in recent years and his death strained United StatesSoviet relations.

title: Around the Nation
description: CHICAGO. Feb. 17 (AP)  The Federal and local authorities are investigating crude and ugly reports that Chicago police matrons have subjected women to intimate body searches after arrests for traffic violations and other minor offenses.

title: When Character Comes to Life in Opera
description: In 1963, Igor Stravinsky emerged from a performance of Don Carlo in Hamburg and, according to his chronicler Robert Craft, rapturously exclaimed: What scope and vitality Verdi had, and with what scale he could endow his people! How I would like to have known him!

title: Television This Week
description: Today

title: ABOUT CARS
description: Q. I JUST purchased a 1979 Chevette without undercoating, primarily because I have read that undercoating, although good as sound insulation, is not effective as a rustproofing measure, which is what I want. A few of my friends have told me that I should have had the undercoating. Who is right and why? JOSEPH RIGBY Mount Vernon, N.Y.

title: Leader of Invasion In Army Since 1927
description: A military leader who has served in the Red Army since 1927... He took part in the Long March... served as a combat commander against the Japanese in World War 11 and in the war against the Nationalists in the late 1946s ... led Chinese forces against United States troops during the Korean War... He was elected as an alternate member of the Communist Party Central Committee in 1956... named commander of forces on the Vietnamese border earlier this year... born in 1910 in Liling, about 50 miles southeast of Changsha, capital of Hunan Province ... The son of a peasant, he joined the Red Army the same year Mao Tsetung visited his home village to organize peasants there... graduated from Nanking Military Academy in 1958... In 1959, on his only trip outside China, he was a member of a goodwill mission to the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe.

title: PEOPLE
description: Bogart Carlaw, the man who gave the world the Campbell Soup Umm, umm, good slogan, died last week at the age of 74. He had been a vice president and copy supervisor for Ted Bates & Company until he retired in 1966, after beginning his advertising career as a copywriting trainee for the J. Walter Thompson Company.

title: Katherine Kruesi Engaged to Marry
description: Dr. and.Mrs. Oscar Rogers Kruesi of Bernardsville, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Katherine Kimball Kruesi, to Daniel Wardwell Lincoln, son of Mr. and Mrs. Brayton Lincoln of Padanaram, Mass.

title: The Curious Crassulas
description: Little plants are fascinating. Some of the most interesting are a group of succulents that come from the deserts of South Africa. These tiny plants, all Crassulas, have intriguing shapes with closely packed leaves in a variety of colors. None be come more than it few inches tall. Although these miniatures belong to the same genus as the well known jade plant, most of them do not have common names.

title: McCarter Ponders Merger
description: PRINCETON CHANGES are imminent for New Jersey's most respected playhouse, McCarter Theater, which at the end of this season will lose both its prodncing director and managing director. As the names of possible successors are bandied about, a hint of another significant change whispers ever so quietly through the 1,100seathouse.

title: BEHIND THE BEST SELLERS
description: Mario Puzo lit a Rey del Mundo that looked as long as Merlin's wand, puffed contentedly, and said:

title: STAMPS
description: John Steinbeck's The Grapes of Wrath was a novel that moved the American people in a way that no novel had done since Harriet Beecher Stowe's Uncle Tom's Cabin almost a century earlier about the conflict between the North and the South that finally erupted into the Civil War.

title: Iowa and Indian Tribe Fighting Bitter Land Dispute
description: ONAWA, Iowa, Feb. 16  Blackbird Bend sleeps easily these days beneath the snows of February, a gentle reach of bottom land, broken by occasional stands of cottonwood, along the frozen waters of the Missouri River.

title: LETTERS TO THE LONG ISLAND EDITOR
description: Re A Mansion's Fate Awaits Zone Ruling: For more than a generation the Island has taken an unyielding stance behind onehouseperplot zoning. And, one by one, architectural masterpieces and historic treasures have fallen before the bulldozer and been replaced by expensive, tacky development.

title: Food
description: For one curious reason or another, one of the most mysterious  even arcane foods in the minds of amateurs is also one of the simplest, most interesting and easiest to prepare. That food is sausage. We were on the verge of writing sausage, pure and simple, but on reflection it must be admitted that there are probably more varieties of sausage known to man than any other food on earth cenrelat, salami, liverwurst, bockwurst, blood sausage, white sausage and so on into the thousands.

title: Knicks Lose 6th Straight
description: Toby Knight and Glen Gondrezick typified the Knicks' plight last night as the team plunged to last place in the National Basketball Association's Atlantic Division.

title: Attack on Vietnamese Compared to the Drive Against India in 1962
description: Shortly before dawn on a chilly October morning 17 years ago, China launched a sudden, overwhelming invasion at two distant points along its rugged mountain border with India.

title: A Talk With the Novelist
description: MY morale is dancing at the moment, Bernard Malamud said on the eve of the publication of Dubin's Lives, a novel that took five and a half years of his life. Although the reviewers ??e public reads had not yet returned their verdicts, Farrar, Straus & Giroux. Malamud's publishers, were confident enough to schedule a generous first printing of 50,000 copies. Mr. Malamud was not pretending to be blase about these early signs of favor. When you work as hard as I did, he said, you want that part ??ular payoff.

title: Albany Sheriff Resigns
description: ALBANY, Feb. 16(AP) Saying he was tired of political disputes, including one over a drastic cutback in the amount of overtime he could spend at the Albany County Jail, Sheriff John McNulty resigned today. Sheriff McNulty, a Democrat who was elected in 1974, said the resignation was effective at midnight. Governor Carey must name an acting sheriff until an election can be held.

title: ABOUT LONG ISLAND
description: NOMENCLATURE is everything. It determines your dignity or the lack of it. It puts you and the world into perspective. Usage can make small things big and big things small. Mention that you live on the Island, and no one will misunderstand that you hole up in Manhattan, one of the smaller islands in our metropolitan area.

title: PAPERBACK TALK
description: Dream world. What should you do after you've sent the manuscript on which you've been working full time for nearly five years to every publisher of fiction listed in the Literary Market Place  and it's been returned every time without a word of encouragement?

title: Strike Dampens Mardi Gras Spirit
description: NEW ORLEANS, Feb. 17  A strange quiet hung over the city this afternoon, a day when residents and tourists here traditionally usher in the 11day Mardi Gras carnival season.

title: National League: Will Rose Make Phillies a Series Hit?
description: After dominating the East for three years, the Phillies signed Pete Rose in the auction market and began to count their blessings. I feel. said Paul Owens, the general manager, like a man playing sevencard stud with nine cards.

title: GARDENING
description: THE season for planting vegetable gardens is not too far away. The weeks of waiting will dwindle down to days in no time. And before we all know it, the planting day will arrive. Those who have planned ahead will be ready.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., Feb. 17 (AP) Duane Barrows, the swimming coach at Indiana State, was killed here today in a traffic accident as the team returned from a twoday road trip to Kentucky, authorities Said.

title: MUSIC VIEW
description: The strike in the opera houses of Paris is over, and on Saturday the Opera will go on with Alban Berg's Lulu as scheduled. But this is not an ordinary Lulu. It will be the first staging ever of the complete work, with its third act reconstructed by an Austrian composerconductor named Friedrich Cerha. (Up to now, Lulu has been

title: Days Of Wrath
description: For all the ways that the Iranian revolution was astonishing, it was most remarkable, perhaps, for standing Mao Tsetung's famous aphorism on its bead. Political power did not grow out of the barrel of a gun; an unarmed population, unified mainly by its hatred for the Shah, toppled a regime armed to the teeth, and suffered relatively few casualties.

title: Double for Heiden, With a World Mark
description: INZELL, West Germany, Feb. 17  Eric Heiden, the American wunderkind of speed skating, won two races and set a world record t day as he began to de fend his world sprint

title: Paterson: On Restoring Glass of Old
description: PATERSON YOU found a lovely old stained. glass lamp in your mother's attic, but the metal was twisted and three glass sections were missing. Or you would have bought that leadedglass window section at the antiques fair, but three of the Danes were cracked.

title: Miss Evert Extended
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., Feb. 17 (UPI)  Chris Evert defeated Virginia Ruzici of Rumania, 64, 64, last night and advanced to the semifinals of a $150,000 women's tennis tournament.

title: New Yorkers Adjusting to Aggieland, and Vice Versa
description: COLLEGE STATION, Tex.  When their dreams began in front of television sets more than 10 years ago, Tyrone Ladson and David Britton never thought that they would wind up here. They did not know about The Spirit of Aggieland, or the Gig 'em sign  the downstate version of Hook 'Em Horns  or the corps of cadets.

title: R.S. Haskell Fianc Of Miss Van Vleck
description: Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Van Vleck 3d of West Hartford, Conn., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Kathleen Dell Van Vleck, to Robert Scott Haskell, son of Richard B. Haskell of West Hartford and the late Kathleen P. Haskell.

title: Tentative Agreement Is Reached In Coast Pulp and Paper Walkout
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb. 17 (AP) Negotiators have reached a tentative contract agreement that could end the largest of the West Coast pulp and paper industry strikes.

title: LONG ISLAND JOURNAL
description: THE retirement of Otis G. Pike has made Representative Lester L. Wolff the senior Democratic member of the Island's Congressional delegation, and he has used his seniority to gain the chairmanship of the Select Committee on Narcotics Abuse and Control, a committee th4t is enjoying a vogue these days, it seems.

title: Dutch Fuzz
description: JANWILLEM VAN DE WETERING's first crime story, Outsider in Amsterdam, appeared only four years ago, but in the United States his work is already the subject of a cult (British reactions have been less enthusiastic). This following is based at least as much upon the author's quizzical attitude to

title: CAMERA
description: Zoom lenses for 35mm single lens reflex cameras have won widespread acceptance in recent years, and in answer to the demand manufacturers have introduced a bewildering assortment of focal lengths and in many different price ranges, with more being added almost monthly.

title: D.A. White to Wed Sharon A. Goddard
description: Mr. and Mrs. Edwin M. Goddard of Ridgewood, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Sharon Anne Goddard, to David Alan White, son of Mr. and Mrs. Louis M. White of Hopkinton, Mass.

title: Charlotte Battle Married To Dr. Edward Robbins
description: Charlotte Timberlake Battle, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Thomas Braswell Battle of Rocky Mount, N.C., was married there yesterday to Dr. Edward Todd Robbins, son of Dr. and Mrs. Samuel Gwin Robbins of Memphis. The Rev. Charles I. Penick performed the ceremony in the Episcopal Church of the Good Shepherd.

title: Suzanne Jardine Planning To Be Married on June 30
description: Mr. and Mrs. Thomas V. Jardine of Rumson, N.J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Suzanne Vreeland Jardine, to John Hardman Robinson, son of Mr. and Mrs. Vincent J. Robinson of Fair Haven, N.J.

title: COURT TOLD OF PLAN TO INFLUENCE NIXON
description: BOSTON, Feb. 17  An alleged plot to raise $500,000 to influence President Nixon's choice of a Republican running mate in 1972 was described here as the trial of two Massachusetts political operatives accused of extortion got under way.

title: Rare Heroin Seized in Chicago
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 17 (UPI)  Investigators have confiscated about $1 million in white heroin, the first Chicago seizure of the rare narcotic since the socalled French Connection was severed with New York nearly a decade ago. Three South Side residents were arrested in their homes last night after a raid that police said should end the recent appearance in the city of white heroin, a 40 percent pure form of the narcotic.

title: Beatrice E. Marden Sets June Wedding To Hotel Executive
description: Mr. and Mrs. William Walker Marden Jr. of Fairfield, Conn., and York, Me., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Beatrice Elizabeth Marden, to Matthew Marshall 3d, son of Dr. and Mrs. Marshall of Pittsburgh.

title: Robert Wilson's Lengthy, Futuristic Play Opens
description: WEST BERLIN, Feb. 17  there was alot of laughter and an occasional stifled yawn, there were cheers, calls of bravo and some boos, and, finally, there were stormy ovations for Robert Wilson, the American director and author, at the premiere here of his latest work, Death Destruction and Detroit.

title: Late TV Listings
description: 11 A.M. (Channel 2) Newsmakers: Deputy Mayor Herman Badillo.

title: Echoes of the 1973 Embargo Sounding in Washington
description: WASHINGTON  It has been a fortnight of dour prophesy. Secretary of Energy James R. Schlesinger's statement two weeks ago that the cutoff of Iranian oil meant a potential shortage in the United States prospectively more serious than the embargo imposed by the Arab oil nations in 1973 was followed last week by Deputy Secretary John F.

title: Paul Bunyan In Connecticut
description: OUR involvement with a woodstove began on a cold February day in 1977 when my husband Peter stopped into the hardware store with the modest intention of picking up a half pint of yellow mailbox paint and was seized by an overwhelming compulsion to own $300 steel box that could be set down in our fireplace without need of any special installation, pipes or holes in the wall.

title: Molly Anne Long, John C. Macauley Engaged to Marry
description: Mr. and Mrs. Robert Edgar Long of Burlington, N.C., have announced, the engagement of their daughter, Margaret Anne Long, to John Chapman Wilson Macauley, son of Mr. and Mrs. Michael Macauley of New Hope, Pa.

title: BRIDGE
description: Some rare moves at the bridgetable are hard to measure statistically. When was the last time you spotted an opportunity for a Deschapelles coup? A smother play? An underruff? A winkle? A devil's coup? Or an overtaking squeeze? For that matter, do you know what all these plays are? If not, you should look them up in some appropriate reference book, such as the Official Encyclopedia of Bridge, for they will not be elucidated here.

title: S.E.C. Takes Hard Line on Options
description: The longawaited Securities and Exchange Commission study on the stock options market saw the light of day at week's end  but it made the exchanges, brokers and floor traders wish it had remained under cover. The report  800 pages and eight volumes worth  called for a complete overhaul of the highly speculative market, saying that the country's stock exchanges had failed to protect investors through adequate policing of trading. In spite of the criticisms, S.E.C. chairman Harold M. Williams said the moratorium imposed on new options trading by the agency 18 months ago might be lifted well within a year  depending on the speed with which the exchanges and brokers respond to the 75 changes the report recommends.

title: Computers to Help Controllers Monitor Air Traffic
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Feb. 17 (UPI)  A $3.2 million computerized air traffic policeman will help open the skies to keep airlines and travelers on schedule when ice and snow force northern airports to close next winter.

title: WW II Stories
description: WORLD WAR II is history. It began 40 years ago next September. We know the outline. Each year brings us one or more books that fill in the detail and, as they do, we gain a better understanding of the complexity, the human tragedies and the delicate balance between victory and defeat involved in the most consuming of all wars that history records.

title: Coghlan Shares Glory
description: SAN DIEGO, Feb. 17 (AP)  Eamonn Coghian of Ireland runs the mile to outrun the others  not to beat the clock.

title: SOVIET IS CAUTIONED
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 17  The United States called on China today to withdraw its forces from Vietnam and said it opposed the invasion with the same severity with which it had earlier criticized Vietnam for attacking Cambodia.

title: Marriage Announcement 3  No Title
description: Pamela Sue Steinfast Affianced

title: ART VIEW
description: Few of us know the name of Paul Joostens, and neither Leon Tutundjian's nor Walter Dexel's is much mentioned in the historical accounts of modern art many of us have learned to rely upon. Erika Geovanna Klien? Ivan Kliun? It is just possible, if we have followed the fortunes of the avantgarde movements that flourished in Russia before and after the 1917 revolution, to have heard of Kliun. But of Nadezhda Udaizova, another of the early Russian modernists, we are likely to know nothing.

title: 11 in Tennessee Dispute To Get Parole Hearings
description: NASHVILLE, Feb. 17 (AP)  Gov. Lamar Alexander said yesterday that he would allow parole hearings for 11 of 49 convicts whose sentences were reduced! former Gov. Ray Blanton in his final days in office.

title: American League: Is There Room Atop Yanks, Royals?
description: The team that lost the division title after the regular season ended will find out if it can overcome the embarrassing loss of Luis Tiant to the archrival Yankees. Bill Lee also is gone from the pitching staff, but that spells relief, not embarrassment, for Manager Don Zimmer.

title: ART
description: THE short stretch of Montauk Highway that runs from Babylon to the Heckscher Parkway might be called the Art Avenue of the South Shore, boasting as it does two townsponsored galleries and several libraries where art exhibitions are a regular feature. Together, these institutions are currently showing wide variety of work by local artists.

title: Places
description: The New York HospitalCornell Medical Center complex, a mighty urban fortress stretching from 68th to 71st Streets east of York Avenue, is one of the city's most dominating edifices.

title: For Singles, a Home of Their Own
description: FOR more and more single and divorced women, the dictum to seek a room of one's own has been updated into the acquisition of a home of one's own.

title: Tanner and Gottfried Gain Final in Tennis
description: RANCHO MIRAGE, Calif., Feb. 17 (AP) Roscoe Tanner's powerful slicing serves were on target today as the lefthander turned back Eliot Teltscher, 63, 63, today in the semifinals of the $250,000 Tennis Games. Brian Gott fried fought back to beat Harold Solomon, 16, 75, 62, and gain the final against Tanner at the Mission Hills Country Club.

title: WESTCHESTER JOURNAL
description: UNDER the nonpartisan system of municipal government, it is the office that seeks the man, rather than the other way around, Mayor James Dooley of Garden City, L.I., said several days ago in Scarsdale, where the nonpartisan system is under attack.

title: DINING OUT
description: NEW HAVEN ONE steps into the tiny establishment that called Annie's Firehouse Soup Kitchen and is immediately attacked by a severe case of dja. vu. All the familiar accoutrements are in place: hanging plants decorating scraped brick walls, menu chalked on wall blackboards, an air Cozy. friendly informality.

title: Radio
description: 67 A.M., WNYCFM. Gregorian Chant; Mass in B minor, (Part I), Bach.

title: Indians: A Historic View
description: [They] have for many ages dwelt in the grossest darkness and heathenism.... David Brainerd. 18thcentury missionary. 1745.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BONN  Few of those who promoted the idea of direct elections to the European Parliament could forsee the developments set off by such decision. Long before the 180 million voters cast their votes in June, this decision has already profoundly affected politics in Western Europe and unleashed processes with dynamics of their own. Three areas are particularly noteworthy.

title: Islanders 5. Canucks 3
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, Feb. 17 (AP)  Mike Bossy, Bryan Trottier and Bob Lorimer scored within a span of 3 minutes 4 seconds tonight and lifted the New York Islanders to a 53 victory over the Vancouver Canucks.

title: Shakespeareans Thrive At Old Berkshire Estate
description: LENOX, Mass.  A band of professional players and directors called Shakespeare & Company has taken over the former estate of Edith Wharton in this Berkshire Mountain community in an ambitious attempt to marry British and American acting styles to a permanent Classical theater.

title: Donald Johanson: Professional With Lots of Luck
description: After decades at center stage in the dramatic search for human origins, the Leakeys have recently been forced to share star billing with Donald C. Johanson, a 35yearold American anthropologist.

title: John Wayne Deluged With GetWell Letters
description: NEWPORT BEACH, Calif., Feb. 17 (AP)  John Wayne has spent his first week at home from the hospital relaxing in the sun, watching television and catching up with more than 100,000 getwell letters and telegrams, a spokesman says.

title: New York State Is Now Buying Cheaper Electricity From Canada
description: New York State's biggestcapacity electric power line has been operating since just before Christmas, bringing relatively cheap, watergenerated Canadian power down to lines that supply New York City and the rest of the state.

title: Legislator Cool to Westchester Parkways Toll Plan
description: WHITE PLAINS, Feb. 17  A proposal to double Westchester parkway tolls to pay for road improvements was outlined at a legislative committee hearing today, but the committee's chairman said he would be very reluctant to go along with it.

title: Keeping Con Ed From Polluting
description: Give Con Edison an A for persistence. In 1974 the the utility applied for a variance from air pollution regulations so that it could burn oil with a higher sulfur content. New York City said no  and New York State, in a recent decision, also said no  because air quality standards for sulfur dioxide are already being violated in the area around the Triborough Bridge. But now Con Edison is back with another request, and it has received a qualified endorsement from Governor Carey.

title: OUTSIDERS SWAYED LATIN CHURCH TALKS
description: PUEBLA, Mexico, Feb. 17  The final statement from the conference of Latin American Roman Catholic bishops, which advocated a degree of activism, was heavily influenced  and in some cases written  by prominent Latin American theologians who had been excluded from the conference.

title: Evangelicals Adding a New Voice to Church Drive for Arms Control
description: LOUISVILLE, Feb. 17  Dr. Larry McSwain spoke of war and peace yesterday to a crowded congregation in the gleaming white sanctuary of Deer Park Baptist Church here. Above the pulpit where he stood, a banner announced, Southern Baptist Convocation: Peacemaking and the Nuclear Arms Race.

title: For the First Time, Militant Hopis Are On the March
description: SHANGOPAVI, Ariz.  On three desolate mesas in the midst of hundreds of miles of the starkest country on this continent sit the oldest continuously inhabited settlements in America. These are the villages of the Hopi, a Pueblo people, an island surrounded by a sea of Navajos, long and bitter enemies.

title: CON EDISON PROJECT MEETS NEW SETBACK
description: ALBANY, Feb. 15  Consolidated Edison's longstanding plan to build a pumpstorage power plant at Storm King Mountain suffered another setback this week when the state's Department of Environmental Conservation asked the Federal Government to revoke a license for the project.

title: Parents See Comatose Child Die After Cutting Off His Respirator
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 17  The parents of a 3yearold boy who had been in coma since he was struck by a car in November cried quietly yesterday as they watched physicians at Children's Hospital disconnect the respirator that had sustained the child's life.

title: Curtain Rises on Opera in Bridgeport
description: BRIDGEPORT OF all the compliments that streamed in last September after of the Connecticut Grand Opera's debut production of Carmen, none pleased the artistic director, Giuseppe Compara, more than a comment by Ezio Flagella, the Metropolitan Opera bass. Giuseppe, Mr. Flagello said during the backstage party that followed the performance, sitting out there in the audience tonight reminded me of the old days at the Met.

title: U.S. Aides Say Russians Didn't Urge Kabul Assault
description: KABUL, Afghanistan, Feb. 17  United States Embassy officials here said yesterday that they felt Soviet officials, who had been advising the Afghan police before the shootout with guerrillas in which Ambassador Adolph Dubs died, had agreed with American advice to use delaying tactics in dealing with the terrorists.

title: A Company at War: How Lilly Defended Darvon
description: INDIANAPOLIS  In 1957, scientists of Eli Lilly & Company here introduced a painkiller that was safer and less addictive than the morphine and codeine that most physicians were then prescribing. The generic name of the drug was propoxyphene hydrochloride, and the brand name, Darvon. In due course, it became the third most prescribed drug in the United States. Then, on Nov. 21, 1978, the media relations director at Lilly, Russell Durbin, received a call from an Associated Press reporter in Washington. What, he asked, had Lilly to say about a petition to ban Darvon?

title: T.P. Brogan, a Law Student, Will Wed Lynn Clark in Fall
description: Dr. and Mrs. Robert E. Clark of Pound Ridge, N.Y., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Lynn Marie Clark, to Thomas Peter Brogan, son of Dr. and Mrs. John J. Brogan of Philadelphia. An autumn wedding is planned.

title: CHILEAN DELAY SEEN IN THE LETELIER CASE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 17  The Supreme Court of Chile is expected to spend at least a month more deciding whether to extradite three Chilean army officers who have been indicted in the United States on murder charges in the assassination of Orlando Letelier, the former Chilean Ambassador to Washington.

title: Historic Districts: A Preservation Clash
description: SMITHTOWN PEOPLE have a right not to be confronted with a plastic America every time they walk down the street, said Robert McKay, director of the Society for the Preservation of Long Island Antiquities.

title: After 40 Years, Apollo Returns to Legitimate Stage
description: Ernest Thompson, actorplaywright, is having his first play produced on Broadway. Critics Off Broadway, where his play On Golden Pond was presented last fall, praised the comedy, as did critics who saw the show at the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts earlier this month, in Washington, and in Wilmington, Del., Mr. Thompson's hometown. It comes to Broadway, into the New Apollo theater, next week  but that's not the story.

title: Jazz
description: The names of the songs tell the story. Rampart Street Rag, Basin Street Blues, Bourbon Street Parade. It was way down yonder in New Orleans where jazz was born, a music that echoed out of the dance halls and marched along the streets called Rampart and Basin and Bourbon, good time music made for dancing and drinking, for laughing and crying, for getting buried.

title: Republican View
description: IT IS undeniable and widely accepted that state government budgets are documents rooted more in political considerations than in fiscal grounds, but the proposed spending program submitted by Gover nor Byrne carries this concept further, perhaps, than any similar document in recent years.

title: THE MARKETS
description: How do you make a silk purse out of a sow's ear the stock market?

title: A Book of Admirations
description: LECTRICDELIGHTS, by the English poet, novelist and librettist William Plomer, is a posthumous miscellany: literary essays, travel pieces, autobiographical snippets, two stories, four commentaries on Benjamin Britten  with whom Plomer collaborated on Gloriana and other operas  and a sampling of the au

title: Country Harmonies With Flash
description: AMITYVILLE THE sounds coming from the bandstand at Amityville's Pastime Pub are bright and crisp, and the spirit of fun is undeniable. Six performers, calling themselves Otter Creek, recreate the kind of musical atmosphere that prevailed in the honkytonks of America's Southwest more than 40 years ago, and yet the beerdrinking, footstomping crowd's enthusiasm would suggest that nothing could be more contemporary.

title: Marriage Announcement 1  No Title
description: Robin Anne Parker Is Engaged

title: PHOTOGRAPHY VIEW
description: A lot has happened to photography in the 20odd years since Robert Frank took the pictures of America that made him famous. In the late 1950's photography was still a journalist's medium, and Frank's pictures were seen as a commentary on the country he was photographing. Now photography is an art and Frank's pictures are seen as a commentary on the photographic process itself.

title: HOME CLINIC
description: WHEN a radiator doesn't get hot, or doesn't heat up all the way across even though all the other radiators seem to be working properly, chances are that the radiator in question is airbound and needs bleeding to get it working again. Ii a sizable bubble of air gets trapped inside a radiator, it keeps water or steam from filling it completely, and as a result the radiator does not get hot all the way across. In some cases, particularly in a steam system, the radiator may not heat up at all.

title: The Model Life of Larry DiRubbo
description: BUCHANAN A SOFT light from Larry DiRubbo's apartment on Lindsey Avenue here is barely visible from the street. He is home, but in a rear workroom with plenty of light, assembling his third Aeromaster model biplane. He calls it highly modified and explains that he is experimenting with Styrofoams, polyurethanes and other materials, looking for strength.

title: Carolina Trailer Fire Kills 4
description: WINTERVILLE, N.C., Feb. 17 (AP) Fire swept through a trailer home in this eastern North Carolina community early today, killing four persons, including 5yearold twin girls, fire officials said. The girls' 2yearold brother and a 38yearold man were also killed.

title: Controversy Mars New Haven Gifts
description: NEW HAVEN THE intent of an unusual plan to compel the Olin Corporation to make amends for corporate crimes of great magnitude by making charitable contributions in the New Haven community was clouded by cynicism from several quarters last week after the recipients were announced.

title: ANTIQUES
description: Period miniatures, whether they be illuminated illustrations from medieval manuscripts, enameled Renaissance portraits or turnofthecentury graphics, win or lose admirers by the degree of deftness, the intensity of color and the wit or the wonder expressed in each Lilliputian image. Actually, the appeal of anything small that is meticulously crafted is as old as collecting, a human foible that probably began while man dwelt in caves.

title: How to Regulate Primaries
description: Election year 1950 will set a record. record. the electorate will have to endure 32 Presidential preference primaries. The galloping increase  there were only 15 primaries in 1968  is largely the product of party reform, but its defects are apparent. The spring primary season, about twice as long as the general election campaign, has become exhausting, appallingly expensive and increasingly complicated and confusing.

title: On TV, Businessmen Wear Black Hats
description: In the summer of 1977, a play entitled The Quadrangle was presented at a small theater in Beverly Hills. The author was Arthur Ross, writer of more than 100 teleplays and over 20 screenplays. The plot was about relations be

title: Mets: Hope, Doubts For the Other Team
description: As the other team in town, the New York Mets have been finishing in last place for two straight years while the Yankees have been lording it over everybody else. So now what can they do for an encore?

title: State Lagging in Aid To Victims of Crime
description: NEWARK EARLY in 1974, an executive secretary out for a walk near her home in Haddon Township, in Camden County, was assaulted by a mugger with a metal bar. She suffered severe brain damage that permanently disabled her, and she lost her job.

title: How Far Do the Powers of the
description: TRENTON THE state government is currently confronted with two constitutional issues of considerable importance, one involving the powers of the Governor and the other the Dowers of the courts.

title: Monmouth Park Will Use New Parimutuel Machines
description: OCEANPORT, Feb. 17  Following the lead of New York tracks, Monmouth Park is installing cashsell parimutuel machines for its meeting opening May 25.

title: Births
description: COHEN

title: IN BRIEF
description: the nation's industrial output rose by a sluggish onetenth of 1 percent in January the smallest amount in a year according to the Federal Reserve Board. Last month's slim increase fol lowed hefty gains in the previous three months and partly reflected the impact of heavy snowstorms ... The consumer spending boom showed signs of tapering off last month, according to the Commerce Department. The January increase of fourtenths of 1 percent in retail spending was the smallest monthtomonth gain since July, when spending fell threetenths of 1 percent The Department also reported that personal income rose percent last month. the smallest gain in a year and housing construction plunged 19 7 percent last month to its lowest level in two years

title: Tested Plan Ready in Jersey
description: TRENTON, Feb. 16  According to Governor Byrnes office, New Jersey can implement within hours a tested plan for gasoline rationing: Those whose automobile license plates end in an odd number may buy gas only three days a week while drivers with plates ending in an even number may buy on the three other days. All service stations would be closed on Sundays.

title: An Eye for Buildings Character
description: PORT WASHINGTON LIKE human beings, buildings do have personalities, but it is especially difficult for a photographer to record them. They can have changeable moods, subject to the most fickle differences in times of day and the light that illumines them. The perceptive photographer must choose that very moment that best illustrates a building's character.

title: SADAT SEES BROWN; BARS A COMPROMISE
description: ISMAILIA, Egypt, Feb. 17  President Anwar elSadat told Secretary of Defense Harold Brown today that Cairo would make no more concessions to Israel in the effort to achieve a peace treaty, according to American sources.

title: A Correction
description: The correct term for the large Chinese jar shown in the Antiques column for Feb. 11 is sevencolor jar. Because of an error in transmission this became sevenpillar jar. There is no suchthing ??

title: Deaths
description: CROWLEYJohn W. of Malverne, N.Y., on Feb 15, 1979. Former N.Y.C. Depufy Register. Husband of Helen. Survived by 5 sons. Reposing Flinch & Bruns Funeral Home, 34 Hempstead Ave. Lynbrook. Mass Our Lady of Lourdes R.C. Church. Tuesday, 9:45 A.M. Visiting 24. 7.9 P.M.

title: WESTCHESTER GUIDE
description: The inspiration for citybred Chris Gabriel to become a trainer of Alaskan malamutes and a confirmed dogsledder was a bronze statue in Central Park of Balto, the dog who brought diphtheria serum to Nome, Alaska. At 2 P.M. today, Mr. Gabriel will give a sledding demonstration and a lecture at the Ward Pound Ridge Reservation.

title: Richard Bentz Jr., Engineer, And Michelle E. Hoest Wed
description: Michelle Elizabeth Hoest, daughter of William P. Hoest of Huntington, L.I., and Mrs. Richard Pike of Sydney, Australia, was married yesterday to Richard William Bentz Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Bentz of Syosset, L.I.

title: How to Dupe the Snoopers
