There are respected seniors still working, of course, but with the deaths of Pablo Casals and Gregor Piatigorsky, and with the entry of Mstislav Rostropovich into a major conducting career, the bulk of cello attention nowadays centers on the under35 generation.

title: City Boy
description: COBLESKILL, N.Y., Feb. 21 Assembly Speaker Stanley Fink, a self-acclaimed city boy, journeyed into this farming community today with the message that upstate rural areas were not all that different from his home district in Canarsie.

title: Sound
description: TO write about how to listen to a loudspeaker may seem like discoursingon how to eat a meal. Pleasure, it could be argued, should be immediate and natural, and independent of instruction. But such romantic viewpoints notwithstanding, there is as much to be said for the trained ear as for the educated palate, and I am convinced that increased aural awareness adds enormously to one's enjoyment of music.

title: Carter Bids States Aid Price Fight
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  Warning that they will be subject to strong pressures from specialinterest groups, President Carter called on the nation's governors and mayors today to support his anti inflation program by adhering to his wage and price guidelines.

title: ESSAY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  A reefer is newspaper slang for a short notice on the front page referring the reader to a story inside. Editors use reefers when they do not want to sensationalize a story with frontpage treatment but do not want to bury it, either.

title: AsianAmerican Actors Get Pledge From Papp
description: A group of AsianAmerican actors has been assured by Joseph Papp, producer of the New York Shakespeare Festival, that the festival will employ significant numbers of Asian-American actors, playwrights and directors in future productions at its Public Theater.

title: Miss Nelson. Eyeing U.S. Downhill Title
description: WILMINGTON, N.Y. Feb. 21 Cindy Nelson of Lutsen, Minn., turned in the fastest time of the day as candidates for the United States men's and women's downhill skiing, championships tuned up today on challenging Whiteface Mountain for tomorrow's competition.

title: The Foreign Bankers Are Coming
description: When a group of Arabs assisted by Bert Lance attempted to buy a modestsized bank holding company last year, it made headlines. But that affair was merely a ripple in a wave of major bids by foreigners for American banks. High on the list are Marine Midland and the National Bank of North America, the 15th and 40th ranking banks in the country, as well as the retail operations of giant Bankers Trust.

title: Beaths
description: FEUCHTMrs./Anna E., nee Anna Elizabeth Wehrnboefer, born January 23, 1885. ape 94, died suddenly on February 17, 1979 In her home In Forest Hills, NY. She is the beloved wife of the late Adolf Feucht and beloved aunt of the late Frederick W. Schriefer & Mrs. Helen S. Rugger. Mrs. Feucht will repose at the Fox Funeral Home, 9807 Ascan Avenue. Forest Hills, NY on Thursday, February 22, 1979 with religious services at Immanuel Lutheran Church. 210.10 Horace Harding Boulevard, Bayside, NY on Friday, February 23, 1979 at 10 AM with Rev. John Weldon, pastor officiating. Inter. ment will be in the Lutheran Cemetery, Middle Village, NY. Mrs. Feucht is survived by 3 grand nieces and 5 grand nephews. In lieu of flowers, memorial gifts to Immanuel Lutheran Church of which Mrs. Feucht was a lifelong member will be appreciated.

title: F Train Has HardLuck Night
description: A hardluck subway train threw much of the IND line into confusion last night after suffering two mishaps in a matter of minutes.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: ARRIVINGTOMORROW, Feb.23 GUGLIELMO MARCONI (Italian Line Cruises international). Left St. Thomas Feb. 19; due 8 A.M. at W. 55th Street.

title: 5 City Operas on Sundays Scheduled for WNCNFM
description: Five Sunday productions from the New York City Opera's spring season at the New York State Theater will he broadcast by WNCNFM, start ing March 4 with Rigoletto. The broadcasts will begin at 7 P.M.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Silver and copper futures set records again yesterday, but the markets ran out of steam late in the session and closed with modest gains. Gold futures were basically unchanged and platinum prices were mixed.

title: Shareholders Vote Technicare Merger
description: The Technicare Corporation said that its shareholders had approved at a special meeting the previously proposed acquisition of the company by Johnson & Johnson.

title: 10.5% Yield On Utility's Bonds Set
description: Yields on mediumgrade utility bonds climbed yesterday to 10.50 percent  their highest level in more than three years  but the rate of return failed to stir investors and the securities sold slowly.

title: West German Arrested as a Spy
description: HANOVER, West Germany, Feb. 21 (Reuters) A 35-year-old Volkswagen worker has reportedly been arrested on suspicion of spying for East Germany for seven years. The man, whose name was not given, was said to have been arrested on Monday.

title: The City
description: Three white youths were arrested yesterday after they allegedly drove up to Richmond Hill High School in Queens and, armed with a tire iron and other weapons, got into a fight with a group of black students outside the school.

title: Track And Field
description: TUESDAY AT PR INCETON, N.J.

title: Amid Rain and Slush, City Gets Disaster Aid For Storms in January
description: Unseasonably mild temperatures and sporadic rainfall continued to turn snowcovered street corners and sidewalks into a sloppy mess yesterday as New York City was designated a Federal disaster area because of damage sustained during bad weather last month.

title: 900 Stuck 2 Hours in Hudson Tunnel
description: HOBOKEN, N.J., Feb. 22  About 900 morning rushhour commuters, stranded on a Manhattanbound train after the power went out in a Hudson River tunnel, endured their twohour travail with jokes, songs and chitchat. Calm prevailed on all seven cars of the Hudson Tubes train, and no injuries were reported.

title: Convicted Former Officer Sought
description: Thomas Ryan, the first New York City police officer ever convicted of homicide while on duty, failed to surrender in the Bronx yesterday to begin serving a fourwear Prison term.

title: PAUSE APPEARS OVER
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 21  China has renewed its advance in Vietnam after a pause to resupply its troops, and Vietnam has begun to move up reinforcements, including regular units that had been held in reserve, analysts here said today.

title: Measure To Waive Duty Gains
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  A bill to allow the Treasury to waive countervailing, or penalty, duties on imports that the United States believes have been unfairly subsidized by foreign governments sailed through the House Ways and Means Committee today and headed for a floor vote, perhaps by next Wednesday.

title: Great Powers: A Testy Mood
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 21  Increasingly heated exchanges between Washington and Moscow are rapidly spoiling the improvement in SovietAmerican relations so laboriously achieved since the summer.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Yastordria Weaning at 1 P.M.: National Oceanic and Atmos PINtle Administration/UPI

title: 2 Die as a Freighter and a Ferry Collide in Fog in the Dover Strait
description: DOVER, England, Feb. 21 (AP)  A French crosschannel ferry and a Liberianflag freighter collided in the Dover Strait in thick fog today. Two persons were reported killed and three injured.

title: Veterinarians Who Make House Calls
description: IT'S practically unheard of for a doctor to pay a house call, so it may come as a surprise to learn that such service is available for pets. You don't have to live in the Dales country of James Herriot's All Things Wise and Wonderful either, but anywhere in Brooklyn or lower Manhattan (below 23d Street), where the Mobile Veterinary Unit makes its rounds.

title: Jersey Casino Official Assails Interference By Byrne on License
description: ATLANTIC CITY. Feb. 22  New Jersey's Casino Control Commissioner, Albert W. Merck, charged Governor Byrne today with improper interference in 1 urging swift action on Resorts International's application for New Jersey's first permanent casino license.

title: Q&A
description: Q. We have recently had new butche erblock counter tops installed in our kitchen and are unsure about how to finish them. Linseed oil, lemon oil and mineral oil have all been suggested, as has polyurethane. What would you advise?  L.M., New York City.

title: Mortgage Revenue Bonds Sold
description: Using its tax.exeinpt borrowing status, Albuquerque. N. M., sold $78.1 million of residential mortgage revenue bonds yesterday to raise money to provide home buyers with loans at rates moderately above 8 percent, instead of the 10 percent or more now typically charged by banks and savings and loan associations.

title: News Summary
description: THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 22, 1979

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: After 13 years with the American Telephone and Telegraph Company and 10 years with Salomon Brothers, Robert E. La Blanc is about to move to the Continental Telephone Corporation as vice chairman. In that post, he will join with Charles Wohlstetter, its chairman and chief executive officer, and J.W. Napier, its president, in the senior management ranks of the nation's thirdlargest independent telephone company.

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: Dr. Anthony N. Domonkos, 66; Was Professor of Dermatology
description: Dr. Anthony N. Domonkos, professor emeritus of dermatology at Columbia University's College of Physicans and Surgeons, died Monday at the Presbyterian Hospital in Manhattan. He was 66 years old and lived in Manhattan.

title: Indianapolis Rubber Profit
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Feb. 21 (UPI) The Indianapolis Rubber Company, bought by local investors from Uni royal Inc. to save about 600 jobs. earned $650.000 on sales of $23 million in its first 12 months of operation, the company announced today. Of the $650,000, about $90,000 must be used to pay debts, including the mortgage to Uniroyal and the group of three Indianapolis banks that advanced loans for the purchase. Part of the agreement calls for sharing half of all earnings after debt payments with the employees in return for certain concessions from the union.

title: Last Inmate Held in Attica Case Is Tentatively Granted a Parole
description: Yesterday, more than two years after Governor Carey tried to firmly and finally close the book on the 1971 Attica prison riot, John Hill, the last inmate still imprisoned in connection with the uprising, was tentatively granted parole.

title: United Press International
description: POLICE CLASH WITH STRIKING FARM WORKERS: Monterey County Sheriff's Deputies struggling with members of the United Farm Workers yesterday in Sall nas, Calif. Demonstrators were attempting to enter Sun Harvest company's field where nonunion workers were harvesting cauliflower. Twenty strikers were arrested.

title: High Court Rebuffs Cleveland
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)  The Supreme Court refused today to review an appeal brought by financially troubled Cleveland in a dispute over its authority to issue $20 million in bonds to pay off some electric bills.

title: Bennett Took On Quite a Dare
description: IN the Michael Bennett musical Ballroom, Dorothy Loudon is middleaged, widowed and rather hesitantly venturing into the night life of the lonely at the Stardust Ballroom, She hasn't been all that lonely all that long, because the equally midaleaged Vincent Gardenia has taken a decided, if gentlemanly, fancy to her. He walks her back to her place after dancing hours, then bids her a discreet good evening, which is all the bidding she wants.

title: Remember the Mayagiiez
description: There is a difference between flexing American muscles and protecting American lives and, by coincidence, it was illustrated twice yesterday.

title: Seton Hall Women Win
description: SOUTH ORANGE, N.J., Feb. 21 Srion Hall University's women's basketball team opened the second half with an 188 spree and went on to defeat Monmouth College, 61S3. for its third straight victory tonight. Cindy Scruggs, Ena Gorham and Phyllis Mangina had 4 points each to pace the decisive secondhalf drive. Miss Gorham took scoring honors with 12 points. Barbara Paterno and Patrice Murray had 12 points each for the losers. Seton Hall ran its record to 205, while Monmouth fell to 98.

title: Iranians Release Abducted Marine
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 21 (AP)  Iranian authorities today released a 22-yearold American marine who had been taken from a hospital bed the day he was wounded in an attack on the American Embassy last week, according to an aide to Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini.

title: Beaths
description: NEUMANMai, the officers and directors of The Hebrew Academy of Long Beach note with profound sorrow the tragic passim of Mal Neuman. beloved wife of Herman Neuman. our esteemed director and past officer. end mother of our Alumni Shmuel Eptyalm and Leah. May the Almighty console the pereeved family with the mourners of Zion.

title: EARNINGS
description: Litton Industries, the diversified industrial producer, said yesterday its profit almost tripled in the second fiscal quarter, ended Jan. 31, to a record of $50.3 million, or $1.30 a share, from the yearearlier $17.1 million, or 42 cents a share. The recent period ineluded a $13.8 million gain from foreign currency translation, in contrast to a loss of $6.1 million ayear before.

title: Carter to Meet Trudeau March 3
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 The White House announced today that President Carter would meet Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau of Canada in New York on March 3, and that they would attend a benefit concert of the Winnipeg Symphony Orchestra. Mr. Carter and Mr. Trudeau will meet for a private dinner and an informal discussion of Canadian, American and world affairs, a spokesman said.

title: Fred Thompson Got Involved
description: When he was about 5 years old, Fred Thompson moved in with his aunt. My parents had broken up, he recalled. They couldn't find time for either me or my brother. But his Aunt Ira Johnson did. Life is two things, she often told him in their Brooklyn home. One, get an education because once you have a college diploma, nobody can take it away from you. And two, get involved with people. His aunt died recently at 78 but Fred Thompson had obeyed her commandments. He got enough education to be a lawyer and he got in volved with people. Deeply involved. He coaches the Brooklyn Atoms, the women's track club that he organized 20 years ago in the halls of a BedfordStuyvesant community center. Tomorrow night at Madison Square Garden the Atoms will be running in

title: Books of The Times
description: By Christopher LehmannHaupt

title: Around the Nation
description: HOUSTON, Feb. 21 (UPI)  A young Massachusetts couple who fled to Mexico to treat their son's leukemia with laetrile, in violation of a court order, slipped into the United States today to defend their action and show off their seemingly healthy 3-year-old boy.

title: Aaron Douglas, Painter, at 79; Founded Fisk Art Department
description: Aaron Douglas, a leading painter during the Harlem Renaissance of the 1920's, who has been called the father of black American art, died Feb. 2. He founded and for 29 years was chairman of the art department at Fisk University in Nashville.

title: BOC Settles S.E.C. Antifraud Suit on Airco Merger
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged BOC International Ltd., a British producer of industrial gases, and the BOC Financial Corporation, its American subsidiary, with violating the antifraud provisions of the securities laws during the tender offer for Airco Inc., an American industrial gas company.

title: Albany Leaders Reach Pact on Insurance Mart
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21  After more than a week of wrangling that threatPorTI io send the insurance exchange planr.ed by New York to another state. Senate and Assembly leaders reached an agreement today that would open the exchange one month ahead of schedule and allow the governing board to decide whether foreign citizens should sit on the board.

title: Head of SmallItalian Party Is Asked to Form Cabinet
description: ROME, Feb. 21  President Sandro Pertini announced tonight that he would ask Ugo La Malfa, head of the small Republican Party, to try to form a Government. It is the first time since June 1945, at the end of World War II, that a leader of a party other than the Christian Demo1 crats will be asked to do so.

title: Big Board Pact Ratified
description: Employees of the New York Stock Exchange, the Securities Industry Automation Corporation and the Depository Trust Company last night ratified the tentative agreement reached a week ago between negotiators and the Big Board. Federal mediators had been involved in the talks since. midJanuary.

title: India's Defense Chief Tells of Vow by China To Keep Border Calm
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 21  Foreign Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee said in Parliament today that India and China had agreed on preserving the existing tranquillity along their Himalayan border.

title: Nets Win On Late Surge
description: PISCATAWAY, N.J., Feb. 21  The Nets are not supposed to outscore Phoenix, 204, during the fourth quarter, or make nine shots in a row, or score three straight important baskets without letting the Suns put the ball in the air. They have to strain and scratch, while their coach, Kevin Loughery, tries to pull the hair out of his head. The last time the Nets played against Phoenix, they fell 23 points behind before they won. That was morelike it.

title: Payoff Reported For Setting Up Of Airline Theft
description: Louis Werner, the Lufthansa cargo agent who was arrested Tuesday night, was promised 5300,000 for setting up the 55.8 million robbery at Kennedy International Airport last Dec. 11, according to an F.B.I. agent's affidavit. The statement was disclosed at the suspect's bail hearing yesterday in Federal Court in Brooklyn.

title: Design Notebook
description: THE phrase Gucci Cadillac has an inherently funny sound almost like Welfare Cadillac, the title of a popular song a few years back. There really is such a thing as a Gucci Cadillac, but while the song was about those who the songwriter believed could not afford Cadillacs, the Gucci Cadillac is for those who can afford Cadillacs all too well.

title: Clemson Routs Duke As Williams Excels
description: CLEMSON, S.C., Feb. 21 (AP) Billy Williams of Clemson scored 21 points to lead Clemson to a 7049 upset of Duke tonight, knocking the Blue Devils out of a firstplace tie with North Carolina in the Atlantic Coast Conference.

title: Appeal for Neediest in Last Week
description: The 67th annual appeal for The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund has entered its final official week and will end next Wednesday.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: The caption on a photograph in The Times last Saturday, accompanying a review of Twyla Tharp and Dancers, incorrectly identified the male dancer. He was Richard Colton.

title: Connally Starts Campaign for 80 By Assailing Carter in Texas Trip
description: FORT WORTH, Feb. 21 Describing himself as just a concerned American, former Gov. John B. Connally began campaigning for the 1980 Republican Presidential nomination today with a hopscotching tour of his native Texas, assailing President Carter in four cities and telling supporters that the nation was ready for change.

title: Turkish Party Office Is Bombed
description: ANKARA, Turkey, Feb. 21 (Reuters)  A bomb blasted the headquarters of Turkey's ruling Republiczn People's Party today, but no one was injured, party officials said.

title: Tanker Truck Crash Kills Driver
description: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn., Feb. 21 (AP)  A tanker truck carrying liquid nitrogen overturned Tuesday, killing the driver and spilling some of the nonflammable cargo on Interstate 75, the police said. The truck overturned on a small sports car, injuring its two occupants.

title: Supreme Court Roundup
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 The Supreme Court agreed today to hear a case that could have an important effect on the Federal Government's efforts to protect workers from exposure to dangerous substances.

title: Vessel That U.S. Freed Is to Be Sold for Scrap
description: HONG KONG, Feb. 21  The Mayagiiez, the United States freighter whose seizure by Cambodia in 1975 touched off a Navy and Marine rescue operation, is to be scrapped.

title: Gossage's Big Toe Stirs Camp
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 21  While all the other Yankees were running under the hot sun, Rich Gossage sat in a corner of the trainer's room today soaking his right foot in a green tub.

title: Chad Buries Its War Dead but Not Its Animosities
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Feb. 21  A fragile ceasefire between warring Gbvernrnent factions in the subSaharan nation of Chad entered its second official day today. But as the two sides held their fire, and allowed about 500 victims from four days of street fighting to be buried in mass graves, there were predictions of more violence.

title: Mexico Removes Peasants
description: MEXICO CITY, Feb. 21  Mexico has sent troops to the country's rich southeast oilfields to remove roadblocks set up by angry peasants who are demanding compensation for land expropriated by the national oil comoanv.

title: United Press International
description: INSPECTING FLOODCONTROL BARRIER: Margaret Thatcher, Britain's opposition leader, with Horace Cutler, right, leader of the Greater London Council, during an inspection of the $480 million movable flood barrier at Woolwich on the Thames. The barrier, when completed, will protect London.

title: Campus and City Aides Top Field In the Madison Mayoral Primary
description: MADISON, Wis., Feb. 21 (AP)  A University of Wisconsin official and a former aide to Mayor Paul Soglin were the two leaders in a 10candidate mayoral primary and will meet in the general election.

title: 3 Companies Reach Accord on Casino
description: Three companies said they had executed an agreement implementing their previously announced agreement in principle for the construction and operation of the Atlantic City Plaza Hotel and Casino in Atlantic City. The cost of the project is estimated at $50 million.

title: The Region
description: HARTFORD (AP)  Lawyers for Murray Gold, who was convicted in the 1974 slayings of his former wife's parents, have asked the Connecticut Supreme Court to dismiss his conviction. The motion alleges serious errors by Judge George Saden of Superior Court in Mr. Gold's 1976 retrial and a poor defense by his lawyer, William M. Kunstier. Mr. Gold, a former New York City stockbroker, is serving 26 years to life in Somers State Prison after being convicted of murdering Rhoda and Irving Pasternack of Waterbury. The dismissal motion was filed by his new legal team, led by a Waterbury alawyer, Timothy Moynihan.

title: OPTOMETRISTS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 The Supreme Court ruled today, 7 to 2, that a state does not violate the free speech rights of optometrists  or, by extension, other professionals  when it prohibits them from practicing under trade or corporate names.

title: Several Motives In Slayings of 7 Are Under Study
description: Chief of Detectives James T. Sullivan said yesterday that the Harlem apartment in which six men and a woman were slain Tuesday might have been a cutting mill for a smalltime cocaine operation.

title: Beaths
description: STILLMANAl. We record with dew sorrow the death of as beloved member and colleague.

title: Cauthen's Decision Surprises His Agent
description: Steve Cauthen's decision to ride for a year on European tracks came as a surprise to West Coast racing officials  and especially to the young jockey's agent, Harry Hacek.

title: Jazz: Black Artists Group
description: THE Collective Black Artists Ensemble, the 13piece jazz group that has been giving an annual series of concerts at Town Hall, has moved to the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A., where on Tuesday evening it gave the first of its concerts for this season. As a rule, the ensemble's concerts have been built around the compositions of an individual jazz musician who was present to play with, and without, the full band.

title: GOING OUT Giude
description: THE REAL SCORE Marilyn Horne, mezzosoprano of the Metropolitan Opera, is this afternoon's guest of honor at the latest informal session of the New York Opera Club. In an interview, the singer will discuss her 25 years in opera with William H. Wells, club director and annotator of the Lively Arts broadcasts over WNYC. Miss Horne will answer questions from

title: Perkins Appears to Be Giants
description: Ray Perkins, who caught passes in his playing career from Johnny Unitas, Joe Namath and Ken Stabler, apparently has caught the biggest job of his coaching career. The Giants will hold a news conference this morning to announce their new head coach and Perkins, the San Diego Chargers offensive coordinator, is likely to be the choice.

title: A Resurgence in Yaws Is Reported in Several Countries
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 21 Yaws, a potentially crippling and mutilating disease of children that nearly vanished from the world in recent years, is resurgent in several countries.

title: EGYPTISRAELI TALKS ON ACCORD RESUME
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance opened talks in the seclusion of Camp David today with Egyptian and Israeli ministers in a new effort to resolve the remaining but persistent issues that have blocked for months the conclusion of an Egyptian-Israeli peace treaty.

title: Steelworkers Get Strike Checks
description: NEWPORT NEWS, Va., Feb. 21 (AP)  Members of the steelworkers union who struck the Newport News Shipbuilding and Thy Dock Company three weeks ago have received their first strike benefits. Checks ranging from 830 to S40 were distributed by Steelworker Local 8888 from a $396,330 check sent by the union's strike and defense fund.

title: Court Upholds NOW on Boycott
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Feb. 21 (AP) Federal District Judge Elmo B. Hunter today upheld the right of the National Organization for Women to use a convention boycott as a tool against states that have not ratified the equal rights amendment. He called the boycott a legitimate political venture.

title: Market Place
description: INDIVIDUALS investing in over-the-counter stocks may benefit from the experience of an institutional investor who has developed helpful guides for this risky market.

title: A Rosy Future Guaranteed For Youths in Czech Party
description: PRAGUE  If all goes well, in three months Vaclav Novak will become a full member of the Communist Party of Czechoslovakia.

title: Home Improvement
description: Bernard Gladstone

title: Swift Now Pulling Its Weight
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 21  The notion seems unlikely, but according to Donald P. Kelly, the architett of divelsification at Esmark Inc., it is at least possible to think of Esmark without Swift & Company, the oldline meat pecker that created Esmark and still contributes 70 percent of its sales.

title: Strikers Cut Tires, Break Windows To Disrupt School Transportation
description: Bands of striking publicschool bus, drivers, wielding baseball bats and icepicks, damaged more than a score of private taxis hired to transport physically handicapped children to schools across New York City yesterday.

title: Letters
description: To THE HOME SECTION:

title: G.E. and Cox Agree On Terms of Merger
description: ATLANTA, Feb. 21 (AP)  The General Electric Company and the Cox Broadcasting Corporation have signed a definitive agreefnent that would merge Cox with G.E.'s broadcasting and cable television businesses, the two companies announced today.

title: Spending Curb In Connecticut
description: HARTFORD, Feb. 21  Gov. Ella T. Grasso's call for a constitutional amendment to limit state spending seems to fit in with the prevailing political mood of the electorate and her own frugality, but it is causing discomfiture among her

title: Copter Sale to China
description: FORT WORTH. Feb. 21 (UPI) China has purchased nine commercial helicopters from Bell Helicopter Textron for more than $12 million, one of the few sales by United States aircraft builders to the Chinese. James F. Atkins. Bell president, announced yesterday the sale of the Model 212 helicopters, capping five years of negotiations.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: The Screen: Cinema, Dead or Alive
description: CINEMA, DEAD OR ALIVE, which opens at the Film Forum tonight, is a solemn, intensely sincere examination of the filmmaking methods of Switzerland's gifted, politically committed director, Main Tanner, with particular attention paid to the preparation, shooting, editing and scoring of one sequence from Mr. Tanner's 1976 film, Jonah Who Will Be 25 in the Year 2000.

title: Music: Ashkenazy Plays For the du Pre Benefit
description: CARNEGIE HALL looked like the center of the musical world last night. Every row, it seemed, contained several internationally recognized artists. There was much hugging and Kissing, and no little socializing and friendly politicking in the aisles. The event was Vladimir Ashkenazy's piano recital, presented as a benefit for the Committee for the Jacqueline du Pre Research Fund of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society, Inc. Miss du Pre, the British cellist and wife of Daniel Barenboim, was well along in an extraordinary career when she was struck down at age 31 with the paralyzing disease. Her friends and admirers in various countries have formed committees to raise funds for fighting multiple sclerosis, and last night's concert brought in more than $115,000 for that cause.

title: Maverick Soviet Writer Visiting College in Kansas
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 21  Bulat S. Okudzhava is the kind of Soviet.writer you would think would be happy, content, conformist. He is a member of the Communist Party and is frequently published here.

title: U.N. Rights Body Assails Israelis
description: GENEVA, Feb. 21  The United Nations Human Rights Commission accused Israel today of war crimes in the occupied Arab territories.

title: Agency Reports Breach Of Computer Safeguards
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (UPI) The Agriculture Departmert said today that its computer security was so lax that unauthorized employees used the system 6,000 times in one year and had access to secret crop forecasts, census data and trade secrets.

title: Advertising
description: STANDARD BRANDS is out to enlarge the franchise for its Fleischmann's margarine, the best-selling premium brand, with an emotional advertising appeal, mostly on television, to people who have an appetite for life.

title: Higher G.N.P. Seen for Bonn
description: FRANKFURT, Feb. 21 (AP)  The chief economist of West Germany's central bank said today that he expected the country's economy to grow at a faster rate than had been predicted by the Government.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Senate Clears Nominees To Election Commission
description: WASHINGTON. Feb. 21 (A.P)  A long, bitter struggle between President Carter and Republicans in Congress ended quietly today when the Senate confirmed two Carter nominees for seats on the Federal Election Commission.

title: U.N. AWAITS A MOVE BY U.S. ON VIETNAM
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Feb. 21 Security Council members waited today for an expected United States request for a meeting on the situation in Southeast Asia, but China was said to be urging the Americans to delay their move.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, Feb 21,1979

title: Rock: Carolyne Mas
description: CAROLYNE MAS, who opened for the Persuasions at the Other End on Tuesday and Wednesday, seems made to order for a successful rock career. She is a compelling and versatile singer. She writes clever, personal songs that use basic rock-and-roll elements in fresh ways. Her moves and stage presence project just the right combination of spontaneity and professional artifice. She has assembled an impressively tight and passionate band. She has been attracting considerable media attention and the interest of several record companies.

title: $20,000 Check Forging Charged
description: A 4S-year-old Queens woman was indicted yesterday on charges that she had forged company checks worth $20,000 when she was a bookkeeper for the Aviation Development Council. The bookkeeper, Joyce Colantrello, of 6747 136 Street, Kew Gardens, Queens, was accused of forging the signature of the council's director on the checks.

title: SOME IN E.P.A. ASSAIL WHITE HOUSE MOVES
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  A memorandum from White House economists to the Environmental Protection Agency asking for a review of the cost of pending water pollution regulations has intensified discontent that was already developing among officials of the agency.

title: The Kingdom and the World: II For Saudis, Bleakness
description: From Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, go north to a hypothetical high noon and proceed clockwise around the hours: IsraelPalestine Liberation Organization, Syria-Lebanon-Iraq, Iran-Afghanistan, OmanSouth Yementhe African Horn, the Nile Valley. The view is bleak.

title: FORCES OF POI, POT SAID TO PRESS DRIVE
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 21 Troops loyal to the dusted Prime Minister Pol Pot are reported to be keeping the Cambodian war going with persistent and widespread attacks on forces of the new Phnom Penh Government and its Vietnamese supporters.

title: LIBYA RAISES PRICE OF OIL, AND REFINERS CUT U.S. DELIVERIES
description: Libya raised its oil prices by 5 percent yesterday, and several American oil companies announced reductions in deliveries to their customers as the Vfects of the cutoff in Iran's petroleum exports'continued to spread.

title: World Gold
description: WEDNESDAY. FEB. 21. 1979

title: Leader of Italian Rightist Group Facing Charges in Legislature
description: ROME. Feb. 21, (AP)  The Italian Chamber of Deputies cleared the way today for the trial of Giorgio Almirante, leader of the rightist Italian Social Movement, on charges he has created an equivalent of Benito Mussolini's outlawed Fascist Party.

title: Police Say Boy and Girl Paid $60 to Have Father Slain
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 21 (UPI) An alleged murder plot in which two teenagers purportedly paid another youth $60 for killing theii father because he was strict was revorted by the police today.

title: I.B.M. Resists U.S. Court Move
description: The International Business Machines Corporation has responded sharply to a Government motion asking for more information and a reopening of the discovery process in its long-running antitrust litigation against the computer giant, according to documents released by I.B.M. yesterday.

title: Robert Penn WaiTen To Appear at Fordham
description: Robert Penn Warren, author, poet and teacher, will read from and discuss his writing March 27 at 12:30 P.M. in the Campus Ballroom, at Fordham University, on Southern Boulevard in the Bronx.

title: Brady Elected to 6th Term As Jockey Club Chairman
description: Nicholas F. Brady, coowner of Mill House Stables, has been elected to a sixth term as chairman of The Jockey Club, the thoroughbred racing organization announced yesterday.

title: Hers
description: OUT of circulation since a year ago Christmas and stalked by animalish, urges, Jane asked around among her friends not hoarding men if they knew any suitable ones. They answered no. Finally Xenia the worldly said she did know? man who was in town from Minneapolis, where he was a parttime surrogate for a Gex clinic. Should she, Xenia asked Jane, send him round. Though in no position to be difficult, Jane unhesitatingly answered No. Maybe. Jane reflected, Here at last was the bottom tine difference between men and women: aneedy (or greedy) man might resort to a lady of pleasure or freelance surrogate (even enjoying it, to judge by testimonials). But a needy woman would stop just short of corresponding expediencies, which, to be sure, aren't often available, there being no call for them, except among c ha racters in The Delta of Venus.

title: Edward Woolsey Freeman, at 87
description: Edward Woolsey Freeman, a retired New York businessman, died yesterday at his home in Damariscotta, Me. He was 87 years old and had moved to Damariscotta, where he had spent his summers, on his retirement in 1958.

title: U.S. Industry in Mexico's Border Cities: A Promise Dims
description: CIUDAD JUAREZ, Mexico  When the Mexican Government opened its side of the border to American industry more than a decade ago, the move was envisioned as a principal stimulus to the revitalization of that impoverished nation's northern frontier.

title: A JURY IS SELECTED FOR EILBERG TRIAL
description: PHILADELPHIA, Feb. 21 A jury was chosen late tonight, after a full day of questioning in Federal District Court, in the conflict-of-interest trial of former Representative Joshua Eilberg.

title: High Court to Review Denial of New York School Aid
description: The United States Supreme Court agreed yesterday to review the rejection of a request in 1977 by New York City for $3.5 million in Federal aid on the ground that the city school system assigned its teachers in a racially discriminatory way. The Court will decide whether the Federal Government followed the correct legal test when it turned down the request.

title: AllOut Brawl Mars 73 Rangers Victory
description: What does it take to get the Rangers aroused for a game against the hapless St. Louis Blues? At Madison Square Garden last night it took a donnybrook that emptied the benches, lasted more than 15 minutes, carried into the runways to the dressing room and drew 66 minutes in penalties.

title: Sadat Calls the Shah in Morocco, Inviting Him to Return to Egypt
description: CAIRO, Feb. 21 (Reuters)  President Anwar elSadat renewed his invitation today to Shah Mohammed Rica Pahievi to visit Egypt, the official Middle East News Agency reported.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Libya raised its oil prices by 5 percent and several American oil companies imposed new supply cutbacks as the impact of Iran's curtailment of petroleum output and exports continued to spread. Libya's increase followed similar moves last week by Abu Dhabi and Qatar and intensified the pressure on Saudi Arabia to follow. Meanwhile, Shell said it would reduce output from its refineries by 5 to 8 percent, and Phillips Petroleum announced that it would double a previously disclosed reduction in gasoline deliveries to dealers. An official of Atlantic Richfield said his company would soon have to allocate supplies of crude oil and refined products. [Page A1.]

title: Court Declines to Hear TV Reporter's Appeal
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  The Supreme Court declined today to hear an appeal from a former Wichita, Kan., television reporter convicted of criminal contempt of court for refusing to disclose the name of a source who gave him some secondhand gossip about a local murder.

title: Youngsters Create My Room
description: ELEVEN-YEAR-OLD Michael Sid's mother. was home with a sore throat so she missed his march to the podium. But 12-year-old Matilda Prevost's mother was there, giving Matilda occasional squeezes and offering to hold her trophy for her. As for Lori Spielman, who is 10, the occasion seemed a good time to announce: I like designing things my way: You know, not my mother's way, my way.

title: Air Law Prompts 3Sided Fight in Ohio
description: CADIZ, Ohio, Feb. 16  A political and legal war between big Ohio utilities and Federal environmental officials has erupted over efforts to protect Ohio coal miners from losing jobs because of Federal clean air rules.

title: Left Cancels Iran March, Avoiding a Confrontation
description: TEHERAN, Iran. Feb. 21  Iran's largest Marxist organization canceled a march through Teheran today, apparently backing away from a confrontation with Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini's Islamic forces.

title: Youth GUilty in Killing of Family
description: LAWRENCE, Mass., Feb. 21 (AP) A 16-year-old youth has been convicted of three counts of firstdegree murder in the killing of his father, mother and sister. A jury in Essex Superior Court deliberated 4 hours before finding Alfred K. Brown guilty on all three counts. The youth was tried as an adult. The victims were Wilfred W. Brown, 46, an underwriter for a Boston insurance company; his wife, Yoshika, 49, and their daughter, Dorina, 20.

title: Sea Urchins Delay Coast Traffic
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 21 (AP)  Traffic on the Harbor Freeway was disrupted for more than three hours Monday when a dump truck 16,500 pounds of sea urchins dumping what a state transportation officer described as a gooey mess on southbound lanes.

title: 25 City Council Members Demand Koch Reduce His Education Cut
description: A majority of the 43member City Council demanded yesterday that Mayor Koch's proposed $33 million cut in the Board of Education budget be reduced by $33 million to make the total cut $50 million.

title: When Buying a Bed, Beware
description: FOR $120, the Sealy quilted fullsize, superfirm mattress and box spring advertised by an East Side bedding center seemed just the thing for Patricia Lyons's guest room. But when she got to me store, a facsimile ad on the window listed the price at $132. Inside, there was no sign of the advertised special. Instead, a salesman steered her to a set costing more than $300. She asked

title: E.E.C. Joblessness Up
description: LUXEMBOURG, Feb: 21 (Reuters)  The unemployment rate in the European Economic Community rose to 6 percent in January, or 6.5 million people, the Common Market's statistics bureau reported today. Mainly caused by bad weather the rise reflected higher male unemployment in West Germany. Luxembourg and Denmark over last December, when 6.1 million people, or 5.7 percent of the work force, were without jobs. Britain and the Netherlands experienced smaller increases in male unemployment, the statistics bureau said.

title: Backgammon:
description: PEBBLE BEACH. Calif. The Black and White Classic backgammon tournament took place in Pebble Beach last weekend. This special invitational event, limited to 100 players, was won by Aram Kouleyan of Los An2eles. In defeating Hassan Ehsan 2112 in the finals, Kouleyan repeated his 1975 performance by taking top honors in this annual competition.

title: A.T. &
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company raised its quarterly dividend yesterday by 10 cents, continuing a string of dime-a-year increases that began in 1976.

title: Talks Continue In Paper Strike
description: PORTLAND, Ore., Feb. 21 (UPI) Negotiations involving more than twothirds of the West Coast paper workers still on strike were under way or scheduled to resume today after the settlement reached at the Crown Zellerbach Corporation.

title: William Hanway, Retired Official Of International Paper Company
description: William A. Hanway, former secretary of the International Paper Company of New York, died Monday in his Manhattan home. He was 82 years old.

title: U.S. Sets Rate On Mark Notes
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)  The Treasury Department announced today that it would pay interest rates of 6.3 percent and 6.7 percent on bonds scheduled to be sold in West Germany.

title: NATHANIEL H. ROGG
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  Nathaniel H. Rogg, an economist, lawyer and Federal administrator here for four decades, died yesterday of a heart attack while shoveling snow. He was 66 years old.

title: French Get A Plan to Create Jobs
description: PARIS, Feb. 21 The French Government's special adviser an unemployment proposed a plan today to create hundreds of thousands of Sobs.

title: The Ballot in Bangladesh
description: The politics of retribution and the rule of the gun are not on the ascendant everywhere in South Asia. There was also good news this week out of one of the region's poorest countries, Bangladesh. That land, which has seen so many calamities in its barely seven years of independence, was the scene of a parliamentary election unmarred by violence or charges of rigging.

description: COQU ELI CO, by Josef Svoboda. The National T NeVer Of Prague 72 Steas 48th Street and Broadway, 7: 1 5.

title: Hawks
description: SENATOR GEORGE McGOVERN, Democrat of South Dakota: Well, I'm of course very deeply concerned about the Chinese intervention in Vietnam. I think it is an extremely dangerous move. I just hope the Russians will continue to exercise restraint.

title: Jews Say They're Part of Iran Revolution
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 21 Leaders of the Jewish community here, thought to be the largest in any Islamic country, said today that they expected acts of violence against their people, but that they were forming a committee in the hope of convincing the new regime that the Jews wanted to be a part of the revolution.

title: Main Ridership To City Was Up Markedly in 78
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Feb 21  The number of riders on commuter trains coming into New York City from Westchester, Connecticut, Long Island, and New Jersey rose substantially last year, in an acceleration of a trend that began on most lines in 1973. Experts in the region are divided, however, on whether this represents a switch from cars to trains, or simply the railroads share of commuters from the growing suburbs.

title: World News Briefs
description: ROME, Feb. 21  Pope John Paul II condemned all forms of social injustice today in one of his strongest statements on human rights.

title: Rockefeller PublicPark Bequest Has Warm Reception
description: Nelson A. Rockefeller's offer to make part of the Rockefeller family's Pocantico Hills estate g public park was described yesterday as having drawn an enthusiastic reaction from the executive committee of the National Trust for Historic Preservation. The offer includes the fourstory Georgianstyle Kykuit mansion.

title: U.S. Doubts Soviet Will Retaliate Unless China Steps Up Offensive
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  A senior State Department official said today that the Carter Administration did not expect the Soviet Union to retaliate against China for its attack on Vietnam unless the conflict intensified significantly.

title: Messerschmitt Signs Pact With China
description: MUNICH, West Germany, Feb. 21 (AP)  China has signed an agreement with the West German aerospace company, Messerschmitt-Boelkow-Blohm, for television satellites, helicopters and medical equipment, company officials announced today.

title: New Iranian Prime Minister Holds His First Meeting With U.S. Envoy
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21  The United States Ambassador in Teheran, William H. Sullivan, met for the first time today with Iran's new Prime Minister, Mehdi Bazargan, but the State Department had no immediate report on the session.

title: Bache Picks Citibank For MutualFund Role
description: Bache Halsey Stuart Shields Inc., one of the largest nationwide brokerage firms, unveiled a plan yesterday that could put Citibank further into the mutualfund business than any other bank as manager of a family of mutual funds to be sold by Bache and other brokerage firms.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE

title: Miller Outlook On 79 Inflation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 21 (AP)  G. William Miller, the Federal Reserve chairman, told Congress today that prices were likely to be higher this year than President Carter projected and economic growth slower.

description: Menuhin and Ricci to Play Together for First Time

title: Uniroyal Reports Profit, Votes Preferred Dividend
description: ?? Inc., a leading international maker ?? rubber, chemical and ?? yesterday a substantial profit in the fourth quarter of last year, compared with a loss in the corresponding period of 1977.

title: Labor Outlook On Presidency
description: BAL HARBOUR, Fla., Feb. 21  The chiefs of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations seem to have a difficult time living with Jimmy Carter, but that does not mean they are ready to do without him.

title: Aftershocks of Lee Marvin Case
description: PICTURE it: the unmarriage ceremony. As is fashionable, the newlyweds-not-to-be have participated in the writing of the ceremony. Flanked on either side by their respective lawyers, they take turns reading aloud to one another the clauses and waivers that express their sentiments. The lawyers hand them their pens and they lovingly exchange the signatures that will symbolize their nonunion to the world. The ceremony is sealed not with a kiss but with the stamp of a notary public, and the unwed partners live contractually ever after.

title: Home Beat
description: IT'S a very sexy chair, said Ward Bennett, the artist, tastemaker and designer shown here with Shellback, his latest piece of seating. He should know. This is the 106th chair he has designed. It's lower, has a new pitch and when you sit in it, it cuddles you, Mr. Bennett continued. Shellback combines the delicate, natural imagery of the shell with overtones of Art Nouveau and Josef Hoffmann. It has a hardwood ash frame and coil spring

title: Swiss Affirm Plan to Stem Franc Rise
description: GENEVA, Feb. 21 The Swiss National Bank, the country's central bank, reaffirmed today that it was continuing to give priority to holding down the value of the franc by intervening on the foreign exchange markets.

title: New York's Newest Theater Is Quite Old.
description: THE newest theater in New York has soft beige walls, crystal chandeliers and a ceiling full of delicate Adamesque detail molded out of plaster. It is not yet another example of the latest fad among contemporary architects, that of imitating the designs of the past; this one is an old building, 69 years of age, and everything in it is genuine.

title: Draft's
description: BENET-4eura-February 17th NYC In her 95th year. Daughter of the late Col. Thomas C. and Frances Rose Benet. Sister of the late Stephen Vincent Benet and William Rose Benet  Sunrhoed by three nieces and two nephews. Memorial service 2PM. Friday, February 23rd in The Church Of The Ascension, 5th Ave and 10th St. In lieu of flowers, contributions to the Village Nursing Horne, 607 Hudson St., N.Y., NY 10014 would be apPreciated.

title: Kremer Stresses Keeping Within Carey's Budget
description: ALBANY, Feb. 21  The chairman of the Assembly Ways and Means Committee warned today that the state could be in big trouble next year if the Legislature failed to hold the size of the new state budget to the $12.7 billion Governor Carey has proposed, and stopped just short of ruling out the increase in welfare grants called for by the Assembly Speaker, Stanley Fink.

title: New England Young People Battle Rise in Drinking Age
description: BOSTON, Feb. 21  The nationwide trend towards raising the legal drinking age, which was lowered by state after state in the early years of this decade, is beginning to meet organized resistance here in New England.

title: Associated Press
description: Bill Laimbeer, left, of Notre Dame, snaring rebound against Oklahoma City in South Bend, Ind., as Mike Jackson of Oklahoma City and Bill Hanzlik of Irish looked on.

title: Beaths
description: DOMONKOSOr. Anthony N.The members of the Board of Directors. Advisory and Development Councils of the American Hungarian Foundation, New Brunswick, NJ, are profoundly saddened by the death of our distinguished fellow Director, long time friend, benefactor and laureate of the 1977 George Washington Award of the Foundation. His life of example, human kindness and concern, learned in his family home in South Bend, shall remain an inspiration to all who knew him. His Hungarian cultural heritage enriched his life and the lives of all whom he touched as world renowned dermatologist, idnisician, clinician author, teacher, researcher and humanitarian. Our deep sympathy is extended to his daughter Mrs. Oita Altman; his brother Albert and his close friend, Leventon.

title: Salad in the Window: Vegetables That Grow in Containers
description: THERE are many reasons for growing vegetables in containers. For city gardeners with terraces or penthouses, it is the only way. For apartment owners with large windows facing south, it is a delight. For suburbanites with a lot of shade from trees, a sunny patio lined with Dots may be the best location.

title: Opponents Cite Danger Of Right Turn on Red
description: The blind chairman of a commender opposed to the ?? traffic rule predicted yesterday that it would be open season on pedestnans next year if the Federal Government forced New York City to adopt the regulation.

title: Moscow Assails Neutrals in Bloc
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 21 (Reuters)  The Soviet Union criticized Yugoslavia and Rumania today for their neutral attitude to the Chinese invasion of Vietnam. And Moscow again charged that the United States had connived in the invasion.

description: Music

title: Stauffer Authorizes Shares
description: The Stauffer Chemical Company said yesterday that its directors had voted to increase the number of common shares the company is authorized to issue and to effect a 2-for-1 common stock split. The authorized common shares will be increased to 70 million from 30 million. The company has about 21.9 million common shares outstanding.

title: Arbitrator Orders Reinstatement Of 14 Guild Employees at News
description: An arbitrator has ordered the reinstatement of 14 employees of The Daily News who were dismissed on Jan. 12.

title: LEUKEMIA IS LINKED TO SMALL RADIATION
description: BUFFALO, Feb. 21 (AP)  People exposed to lowlevel radiation at work or from frequent medical Xrays may be 10 times as likely to get leukemia as has been thought, according to a new report.

title: Bridge:
description: Examining two partnership hands and then trying to assess the prospects of a contract is a twodimensional exercise. However, in practice it must often be three  or fourdimensional. If one or both of the opponents have entered the auction, the prospects may change, sometimes quite considerably.

title: Stockton, Calif.: Leading the U.S. in Urban Jobless
description: STOCKTON, Calif., Feb. 21 (UPI) Unemployment in Stockton is a family tradition, passing from one generation to the next.

title: Saving of $6:7 Million On Model Cities Cited
description: Eleven months after ordering a restructuring of the city's federally financed Model Cities program to eliminate waste and inefficiency, Mayor Koch yesterday claimed savings of $6.7 million in administrative costs, achieved chiefly by cutting the central staff from 262 employees to 19.

title: Turner's Tenacious Nassau Race Victor
description: NASSAU, the Bahamas, Feb. 21 Ted Turner, the South's leading sports entrepreneur who sails as well as he talks, won the Miami-to-Nassau ocean race today in his whitehulled 61foot sloop appropriately named Tenacious.

title: AT HOME ABROAD Im a South African
description: CAPE TOWN  On the freeway to the airport an exit sign says Langa. Few visitors, and for that matter few residents of Cape Town, ever turn off here. For Langa is a black township, one of the few places in the Cape where black Africans are officially allowed to live.

title: The Editorial Notebook What Makes Some Schools Work?
description: Now that Chancellor Macchiarola has candidly acknowledged that New York City's schools are mired in mediocrity, can he prescribe a remedy? It is a formidable task, but not hopeless. Some innercity schools function admirably. They may be special cases  but perhaps they can serve as models.

description: The Chinese and Vietnamese armies appeared to be moving toward their first major battle of the war yesterday.

title: Grote Is Back to Assist Mets With Minor League Catchers
description: Jerry Grote, for 11 years the firststring catcher on the Mets, agreed yesterday to interrupt his retirement from baseball and serve as a springtraining instructor for the team's corps of minor league catchers.

title: Problems Growing for Vietnam's Forces in Cambodia
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 22  vietnamese forces in Cambodia, though successful in installing a client Government in Phnom Penh and controlling key points in the country's most heavily populated areas, are reported to be facing formidable difficulties that already have seriously complicated their position.

title: Art: Nancy Graves
description: ART has always fed on earlier art. But in our own century it has ranged ever farther and wider in search of nonart images that can be put to good use. It should be borne in mind when we look at Nancy Graves's new paintings, which will be on view through March at Knoedler's, 19 East 70th Street, that ever since the first came to notice around 10 years ago, she has been one of the hardiest of explorers in this-context.

title: Carey, in Rochester, Questioned Dn Dogs and Welfare
description: ROCHESTER, Feb. 22  Governor Carey traveled to this. gray, upstate city today, where he heard citizens express concerns that ranged from the welfare of people to the welfare of dogs.

title: SOVIET ARMS AIRLIFT TO VIETNAM HINTED AS COMBAT GOES ON
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Feb. 22  The Soviet Union appears to have begun an airlift of military supplies to Vietnam, which is seeking to stem an invasion by China, Western analysts reported today.

description: Companies

description: Carter's Amazing Statement on Missiles

title: Practical Coats With the Whimsy of Zandra Rhodes
description: Her hair, once dyed blue or green, is now cyclamen pink, a shade repeated in her lip color, achieved by blending two tones of lipstick. She wears a bright red jersey jump suit over a blouse in one of her own whimsical prints, with an obilike sash in matching satin. Her nails are deep red, with blue tips picking up the blue that rims her eyes.

title: Fourth Dance Marathon At Hofstra This Weekend
description: More than 25 couples will be in step this weekend at the fourth annual Zeta Beta Tau fraternity dance marathon at Hofstra University on Hempstead Turnpike in Hempstead, L.I.

description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 22  Another wave of resignations and early retirements has struck the Central Intelligence Agency, officials said today, amid renewed reports that morale there had plummeted.

title: Billie Sol Estes, on Parole, Indicted On Charges of Tax and Mail Fraud
description: DALLAS, Feb 22 (UPI)  Bilha Sol Estes, still on parole from swindling millions in the 1960's, was indicted today on charges of income tax evasion, mail fraud, interstate transportation of stolen property and concealing assets.

title: TV Weekend Story of a Stuntwoman, With Stockard Charming
description: A DOCUDRAMA about a Hollywood stuntwoman who happens to be deaf may sound more than a bit of fputting, but it turns out to be an unusually wellmade television film and .a triumph for Stockard Charming in the title role. The show, Silent Victory: The Kitty O'Neil Story, will be seen tomorrow night from 9 to 11 o'clock on CBS.

title: Verdi Requiem Memorializes Terezin Concert
description: IN 1967, Roger DeCormier, music director of the Nevi York Choral Society, was in Prague, where he was introduced to a lawyerwriter named Josef Bor. Mr. Bor drove him out one day to Terezin, an old walled fortress town 25 miles northwest of the capital, which had been turned by the Germans into a concentration camp during World War II. It was here that performances of the Verdi Requiem were given in 1949 by the prisoners. The circumstances were so extraordinary and the knowledge of them so vivid in Mr. DeCormier's mind that he decided to commemorate them some day. He will do just that tomorrow night in Carnegie Hall by conducting the choral society in the Requiem, dedicating the performance to the participants in that remarkable concert 35 years ago.

title: Reagan to Set Up Election Panel
description: CHICAGO, Feb. 22 (UPI)  Former Gov. Ronald Reagan of California will set up an advisory committee next month to help him decide whether to seek the 1980 Republican Presidential nomination.

title: Gem and Mineral Show at Statler Hilton
description: Lectures and works by Paul Ernst, coppersmith and silversmith, will be featured at the 15th Gem, Mineral and Jewelry Show this Weekend at the Statler Hilton Hotel, Seventh Avenue and 32d Street.

title: The City
description: A 45-year-old Brooklyn man, who had been accused of causing more than $500 in damage during last December's attack on a Borough Park police station, was fined $250 after being allowed to plead guilty to a reduced charge.

title: Ads Resumed for a Gang Movie After Sporadic Violence at Theaters
description: Despite sporadic acts of violence and vandalism in theaters around the country showing The Warriors, a film about teenage gang violence in New York City, Paramount Pictures yesterday resumed print advertising for the highgrossing film after a sixday hiatus.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: The Dance Theater of Harlem, beset by financial difficulties in recent times, is back in New York City for the first time in two yearsand just in time for its 10th anniversary. Performances at City Center, 131 West 55th Street, are tonight at 8, tomorrow and Sunday at 2 and 8 P.M. Tonight's program highlights works choreographed by Arthur Mitchell, the company's codirector, and the world premiere of a new piece by Carmen de Lavallade. The program tomorrow night is all Balanchine  Mr. Mitchell's tribute to his mentor, George Balanchine, who once made him a member of the New York City Ballet. Tickets range from $3 to $15, available through Chargit (2394177) or at the box office. Information: 2458989.

title: Gambling Stocks Surge; Rest of Market Is Weak
description: Gambling issues scored spectacular gains yesterdair, but the,stock market in general headed lower in moderate trading volume.

title: 30Year Prison Term Of ExOrange Teacher Is Shortened by Byrne
description: TRENTON, Feb. 22  Governor Byrne today commuted the 30year prison sentence of Mims Hackett, a former teacher and black community leader in Orange, who was convicted of assault and kidnapping.

description: The two Chinese offensives in Vietnam in the Lang Son and Lao Cai sectors continue to progress. But they appear to be making slower progress, possibly because of the arrival of regular Vietnamese units on the battlefield.

description: The Rangers lost John Davidson. their goalie in the afterrlath of New York's 73 victory over the St. Louis Blues at Madison Suuare Garden Wednesday night.
