The car, which cost $6,400, gets 16 miles to a gallon of gas. It replaces a 1975 Newport, which cost $4,385 and got 11 miles to a gallon.

title: Into the Wild Blue Yonder
description: FARGO, N.D.  If you were a lad in the early 1920's, lived on a farm or in a small town almost anywhere in the country, you knew What you were going to be when you grew up  a barnstormer.

title: Millionaire Baseball Fan Makes Bid to Buy Orioles;
description: BALTIMORE, Feb. 27 (AP)  A millionaire from WilkesBarre, Pa., described as a baseball nut who has tried to buy baseball clubs all over the country, has offered to put up half the S12 million asking price for the Baltimore Orioles.

title: Critical Look at 76 Burgundies
description: JUST before he died, the redoubtable Frank Schoonmaker had this to say about the 1976 burgundies: A very great vintage year. The wines are deeply colored, full bodied and tannic, well balanced without an overabundance of alcohol. The vintage has all the characteristics of a very great, comparable to the most famous of the last three decades (1945, 1949,1961),

title: Sports News Briefs
description: TOKYO, Feb. 27 (UPI)  Japan, which will host the third Asian track and field meet in Tokyo May 31June 3, will bar Israel from taking part, organizers announced today.

title: Dying Salmon, Greedy Men
description: To a fisherman who has felt the quivering strength of an Atlantic salmon on the end of a fly line, the fish is symbolic of the force of life itself. Yet in the real world, the salmon is more symbolic of pointless death, the result of greedy overfishing and the unwillingness of fishing nations to reduce their take. The readiness of the United States to sponsor a new international conservation commission is good news, though it comes late in the day.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, FEB 27, 1979

title: 110 Million Saw Roots II
description: Roots: The Nelt Generations on ABCTV dominated television viewing last week, as Alex Haley's Roots had done the week it aired in January 1977. The original serial became the most watched single entertainment program in history. Roots II, as the sequel is called for convenience, is now the second most watched. The difference in impact is told in total viewers who watched all or part of the series: 130 million for Roots I, 110 million for Roots II.

title: The City
description: Giovanni Sartori, an internationally known political  scientist, and Aileen Ward, a literary scholar, are expected to be designated Albert Schweitzer professors later this week at Columbia and New York Universities, respectively, sources in Albany reported yesterday.

title: Deaths
description: AMOROSILeo J. Suddenly In Boca Raton, Florida on February 25, 1979. Loving husband of Gloria (nee Ortolani), devoted fatter of Jaime A. Carobene, Janet A. Deegan. Caro. lyn P.. Elise A. and Lorraine G. Amorosi. Also survived by one grandson. Reposing at David J. Hodder A Son. Inc. Funeral Home, env McLean Ave freer Kimball Ave) Yonkers. Mass of Christian Burial St. John and Paul Church, 280 Weaver St. Larchmont, NY Friday 10AM. Interment Gate of Heaven Cemetery. Visiting hours Wednesday and Thursday 2 to 4 and 7 to 10PM. Contributions to the Heart Fund would be appreciated.

title: Chambliss Wrist Placed in Cast
description: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., Feb. 27  Chris Chambliss of the Yankees, who missed three games of last year's World Series because of a broken bone in his right hand, had his right wrist placed in a cast today because of a sprained ligament.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: SINCE this column began more than two years ago, we have printed very few lamb recipes. Someone has asked, in fact, if we like lamb dishes, and the answer is an emphatic yes. Lamb is one of the best and most delicate of meats and, to our taste, more elegant than steak. Curiously, lamb  outside of chops, the saddle and rack generally requires a cooking period that would be in excess of an hour. One of the least expensive lamb dishes, on the other hand, is made with ground meat. It is a dish that I have prepared and served in luxury restaurants, and to the great pleasure of many customers.

title: Koch Urges RentControl Extension
description: Mayor Koch urged the City Council yesterday to extend rem control and rent stabilization for another three years. The local rentcontrol law expires on May 31 unless the Council takes action by April 1. The rentstabilization law expires on April 1.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: James A. Connolly resigned yesterday, effective immediately, as president and chief operating officer of the New York division of Gimbel Brothers Inc., and tongues immediately began wagging in the city's tightly knit retail and apparel communities. The official reason for his resignation, as given in a twosentence news release, was to pursue other business interests.

title: The Only Game in Connecticut
description: Red Smith

title: G.E. Quits Fonda Show Over AtomPower Issue
description: The General Electric Corporation has withdrawn its sponsorship of a Barbara Walters special program on ABCTV March 13 because the show involves an interview with Jane Fonda. the actress. in which she discusses her new Columbia Pictures release, The China Syndrome, a fictional story about an attempt to Cover up a disaster at a nuclear Dower plant.

title: Carey to Ask U.S. Aid for Welfare
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  Governor Carey announced today that he would seek Federal relief for New York welfare programs through direct grants rather than through welfare reform.

title: A Daring Moscow Venture Comes to Grief
description: MOSCOW, Feb. 27  The men who run the Soviet Union have never liked Eurocommunism, the movement among Communist parties of such countries as Italy and Spain rejecting the Soviet Union as a model or ideological guide.

title: Blumenthal Delivers Warning
description: PEKING, Feb. 27  Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal delivered message from President Carter to China's leadership today calling for the withdrawal of troops from Vietnam as quickly as possible because the invasion ran risks that were unwarranted.

title: Ash Wednesday Rites Being Observed Today
description: Roman Catholic, Episcopal and some other Protestant churches will be open today to dispense ashes, a symbolic gesture that denotes start of the penitential theme of Lent, Christianity's most solemn season.

title: Tech's Corridors a Running Track
description: The fourth floor at Brooklyn Technical High School houses more than the conventional classrooms and labs. Its corridors serve as the track for the best girls track team in the city.

title: Dip Predicted In World Grain
description: ROME, Feb. 27 (UPI)  World cereal production may decline from last year's peak, but grain exporters have record supplies left over from last year and stocks are rising, the Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations has reported.

title: Two Recipes for Making Blini
description: Here are two blini recipes. The first is from the Russian Tea Room, which uses more than a ton of buckwheat flour to make the more than 315,000 blini it serves yearly. Besides producing a delicate, lacy pancake, the Russian Tea Room recipe is one of the quickest and simplest that work. The restaurant serves the blini with about two and a half ounces of red caviar (with beluga as an option) and the basic topping, sour cream. The second recipe is a more traditional one for blini.

title: Breeding Success Seen for Slew
description: Seattle Slew appears to be as willing and competent in the breeding shed ashe was on the race track.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Stocks Fall 14.12 Points On Oil Rise
description: The Dow Jones industrial average plunged more than 14 points yesterday as stock prices succumbed to the cumulative impact of rising world oil prices and the dashing of hopes for a threenation Middle East summit meeting at Camp David this week.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 2/ (AP)  A Federal safety board says the captain of the Coast Guard cutter Cuyahoga was responsible for a Chesapeake Bay collision that killed 11 of the 29 men aboard his ship.

title: A Feast Of Blini
description: IN the Russian and Ukrainian Orthodox Churches, during the Great Fast of Lent, the orthodox arc strictly vegetarian. Stricken from their menu is not just meat, but milk; not just poultry, but eggs. Fish, too, is forbidden flesh.

title: Eastern
description: MIAMI  Last October the Federal Government ended 40 years of regulation of the domestic airtransport industry. Under the Airline Deregulation Act of 1978, the Government will no longer tell domestic airlines where they may fly or what they may charge. In the face of the wideopen competition this creates, some airlines are seeking to merge.

title: THOMAS P. TREDWAY JR.
description: Thomas P. Tredway Jr., a partner in the New York law firm of Townley & Updike, died Monday at his home in Bronxville, N.Y., after a brief illness. He was 62 years old.

title: Economic Scene
description: THIS was to be the catchup year for the dollar, with a return to equilibrium among the industrial countries as the United States economy slowed down and the Western European and Japanese economies moved up faster. Then came the upheaval in Iran, the cut in world oil supplies and the runup of oil prices. Is it a new ball game now? Is the industrial world facing a shock like that provided by, the energy crisis of 1974?

title: Begin Is Not Expected to Consult With Egyptians on His Trip to U.S.
description: JERUSALEM, Feb. 27  Israeli officials said tonight that Prime Minister Menachem Begin was not expected to meet with Egyptian officials in Washington when he conferred with President Carter on Thursday.

title: Swiss, in a Drive to Erase Rabies, Use a LiveVirus Vaccine in Bait
description: In a bold test of a technique that some specialists believe could exterminate rabies in many parts of the world, the Swiss authorities have reportedly been spreading fox bait laden with livevirus vaccine in a confined Alpine valley.

title: New Central Park Overseer
description: When Betsy Barlow was a young girl growing up in Texas, she spent summers poking around the fields and streams in Johnson City ("in L.B.J. land, she says), and her father encouraged her interest in the outdoors.

title: COMMODES
description: Silver futures set the pace for some of the strength in other commodity futures prices yesterday, and the reason was news during the trading day that Vietnamese forces had raided China

title: Talks Broken Off in Milk Walkout As Metropolitan Area Supply Falls
description: Talks in the fourdayold milk strike broke off yesterday after a fruitless negotiating session. No new meetings were scheduled in the walkout that has sharply cut supplies of fresh milk to stores in New York City and Long Island.

title: Blue Shield Not Exempt From Antitrust Laws
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  The Su preme Court ruled today, 5 to 4, that Blue Shield plans haw> no automatic exemption fro;;, the antitrust iaw5 when they enter into contracts to rei rrt burse providers of healthcare service for specific fees.

title: Radio City Hall Is To Stay Open Under New Plan
description: Radio City Music Hall  threatened for more than a year with being shut down will remain open, but its traditional movieandstageshow programming will be replaced by a wider variety of entertainment, officials of Rockefeller Center announced yesterday.

title: Entertainment Events
description: ON GOLDEN POND, by Ernest Thorresson. Nee Apollo Theater, 234 West 43d Street,6: 33.

title: Best Buys
description: WHY, many consumers ask, doesn't the United States import more beef to increase competition and lower prices? Importation would seem to be a logical enough approach to a problem that is especially acute in New York City, where the average price of a pound of ground chuck has risen 57 percent during the last year.

title: SAFETY RULES URGED FOR MISSILES IN TOYS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  Action for Children's Television, which has long been associated with opposition to abuses in advertising aimed at children, asked the Government today to regulate toys that fire missiles, including the popular soace toys of last Christmas.

title: News of the Theater
description: JOHN CULLUM, nearing the end of his run as the Tony awardwinning star of On the Twentieth Century, is losing no time getting started on his next project. On March 19, the day after the musical closes, be will begin rehearsals for his next project, H. Jean Schaeffer's new play, People in Show Business Make Long Goodbyes.

title: STROKES INCIDENCE DOWN, STUDY FINDS
description: The incidende of stroke has declined dramatically, according to a 30year study by a team of doctors from the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minn., scheduled for publication in a medical journal tumorma.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: AMF Inc., manufacturer of leisuretime and industrial products, has appointed John J. Hickey president of its North American tobacco operations.

title: President Won't Condemn Brother's Remarks on Jews
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  President Carter told a news conference today that he had no intention of condemning his brother Billy's comments about Jews and contended that the statements were not antiSemitic.

title: SchoolBus Bid Opening Extended; May Speed End of Driver Walkout,
description: Today's deadline for opening bids for new schoolbus contracts to transport 32,000 handicapped children to. New York City schools was extended yesterday until March 8. The move could help to end a wildcat walkout by schoolbus drivers.

title: Takeover Of Ticor
description: LOS ANGELES, Feb. 27  The Ticor Corporation, which is pulling out of a long financial slump, announced yesterday an agreement in principle for the Southern Pacific Company to take it over for $258 million.

title: Iranian Premier Predicts Referendum in a Month
description: PARIS, Feb. 27 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Mehdi Bazargan of Iran was quoted today as saying it would probably be at least a month before a referendum could be held on establishing an Islamic republic in his country.

title: Letters
description: TO THE LIVING SECTION:

title: Falling Ice and Floods Mar Better Weather
description: Rising temperatures brought some relief from February's boisterous winter weather yesterday but created hazards in the form of falling ice and the flooding of streams and rivers swollen by melting snow.

title: Transcript of the President's News Conference on Foreign and Domestic Matters
description: Following is a transcript of President Carter's news conference in Washington yesterday, as recorded by The New York runes through the facilities of ABC News:

title: SOUTH KOREA NEARS ANOTHER CROSSROAD
description: SEOUL, South Korea, Feb. 19  The elderly and ailing former President, Yun Po Sun, sat by a log fire in his home, shielding his weakened eyes from the Crackling blaze. They say it comes from the brain, this eye trouble. he said.

title: Bridge:
description: If an expert sits down behind a player he does not know, he can usually judge quite quickly whether the focus of his attention is a beginner, a moderate player or an expert. But sometimes he can be nuzzled.

title: Eclipse Groupies Follow the Sun
description: BIG SKY. MONT.

title: The Region
description: ALBANY  The chairman of the Senate Transportation Committee said yesterday that he would block the confirmation of the six gubernatorial nominees to the board of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority until he reached an agreement with the Governor's office on restructuring the board to provide for more suburban representatives.

title: John A. Blake, Taught At Fordham 28 Years
description: John A. Blake, a member of the Fordham Law School faculty from 1919 to 1947 and a lawyer in Manhattan for many years, died Sunday at Lawrence Hospital in Bronxville, N.Y. He was 86 years old, and was a resident of Bronxville.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: MIDNIGHT RAINBOW Embraceable You sounded good, even fresh, over pork chops recently down in SoHo. Who was playing and singing? Although the microphoned music carried distinctly to the front dining tables, Mama Siltka's is a buzzing, cavernous place, with the piano across the room beyond the bar. The entertainer turned out to be a young woman named Amine Myers.

title: Desai Discloses India Has Asked Vietnam to Get Out of Cambodia
description: NEW DELHI, Feb. 27  Prime Minister Morarji R. Desai said today that India had asked Vietnam to withdraw from Cambodia.

title: PRESIDENT STRESSES FUELSAVING RULES ARE ONLY STANDBY
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  President Carter said today that it was important for Congress to give him the authority to impose measures to conserve oil, but he did not commit himself to invoking them despite the prospect of a serious shortage because of the cutoff of imports from Iran.

title: A WOMAN APPEALING BAR EXAM SETBACK
description: RICHMOND, Feb. 27  The Virginia Supreme Court of Appeals heard arguments today in the appeal of Bonnie C. Cord, who was prohibited from taking the state bar examination because she lived with a man to whom she was not married.

title: Blini Served At Churches
description: Several Russian Orthodox churches are open to the public for their annual blini dinners, which generally follow the morning liturgical services (conducted in Slavic, except where indicated). No reservations are necessary.

title: Stein, Saying Carter Can't Make It, Backs Kennedy For President
description: The first major New York City officeholder to break with President Carter, Borough President Andrew J. Stein of Manhattan, declared yesterday that he would support Senator Edward M. Kennedy for the Democratic nomination for President and would sponsor antiCarter, proKennedy delegate mnclidates in the New York Presidential primary next year.

title: Technology
description: AS any parent knows, the trend toward technological toys is exposing more and more children to the industrial world of electronics. engineering and chemistry. But vthat about the reverse? Is there anything that industry is learning from children's toys?

title: Bomb Linked to Puerto Ricans Blasts Mobil Offices
description: EASTCHESTER, N.Y., Feb. 27  A bomb, assertedly touched off for the cause of Puerto Rican independence, inflicted extensive damage on the top floor of a threestory regional headquarters building of the Mobil Oil Corporation here this afternoon.

title: W.B.C., State in Ring Accord.
description: Last Friday night, while the WOrld Boxing Association was arguing with the Nevada State Athletic Commission over who should assign officials to a world championship bout in Las Vegas, a meeting was taking place in the WaldorfAstoria here to make sure no such complication took place before the March 9 world title bout at Madison Square Garden.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS  Rhodesia: Echoing England
description: LONDON  A visit to Rhodesia Is a weird experience for an Englishman, though not quite as disturbing as the return to England.

title: House Passes Bill Easing Bank Rule
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. (UPI)  The House passed and sent to President Carter today a bill eliminating the requirement that banks notify all customers of their rights under the Financial Privacy Act. The vote Wag :tr) in c

title: Business Records
description: BANK PUPCY PPOCEEDINGS, SOUTHERN OISTR??? Tuesday, Feb 27 1979

title: Japan Imports More Beef
description: TOKYO, Feb. 27 (AP)  Japan decided today to import 5,000 more tons of beef in the fiscal year ending March 31 than the 107,000 tons originally planned. The Cabinet said domestic demand was increasing.

title: BEGIN IS DUE TO VISIT CARTER AS ISRAELIS REJECT 3WAY TALKS
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  President Carter announced today that in an effort to keep Middle East peace hopes from collapsing, he would meet alone later this week with Prime Minister Menachem Begin of Israel.

title: Opera: Tom Jones Is Revived in Paris
description: PARIS, Feb. 27  While the very modern Lulu is holding forth at the Thtre National de l'Opra, the very ancient Tom Jones is starting a run at the Salle Favart under the auspices of the OpraComique. Tom Jones, based of course on the Fielding novel, was composed by FrancoisAndr Danican Philidor in 1765. It was a very popular work in its day, and it has great historical significance, but as far as anybody around here knows, it has not been per in Paris for the last hundred years or so. There have, however, been a clutch of performances in England in recent years.

title: Contact Visits Ordered in Jails In 40 Counties
description: A Federal Appeals Court ruled yesterday that more than 40 New York counties must submit plans to allow contact visits for prisoners awaiting trial.

title: Zoning Petition For Boys School Stirs Up Bedford
description: BEDFORD HILLS, N.Y., Feb. 27 For the third time in three months, residents of the affluent, northern Westchester community of of Bedford last night filled a zoning board hearing room to oppose the use of a 296acre estate as a private boarding school for boys and as a study center for a group they contend is a front for a paramilitary organization.

title: Troubled Plane Lands With 16
description: CHEYENNE, Wyo., Feb. 27 (UPI)  A twinengine Rocky Mountain Airways commuter aircraft with 16 persons aboard made a forced landing just after takeoff today, causing a few minor injuries.

title: Rhodesians Extending MilitaryEscort Policy
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, Feb. 27 (Reuters)  The blacknationalist guerrilla war reached closer to Salisbury today with the announcement that civilian traffic would receive military protection almost all the way from the city to the border of South Africa.

title: ENVIRONMENT VOW MADE BY PRESIDENT
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  President Cartersaid today that he had no intention of undermining the nation's environmental laws through his policies to fight inflation and reduce the burden of Federal regulation.

title: I.R.S. Takes Landlord's Subtraction of Light Dimly
description: The Internal Revenue Service is not all powerful, after all.

title: Lancaster, Pa., Newsman Killed
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Feb. 27 (AP)  A newsman for The Lancaster Sunday News has been found shot to death in the apartment of another reporter for the paper, the city police said. The body of George Steven Aument, 23 years old, was found yesterday in the bedroom of an apartment occupied by Nancy Plank, 31, officers said. Mrs. Plank's estranged husband surrendered to detectives shortly afterward, officers said. No charges were filed. The police refused to release further detail of the shooting

title: CORRECTION
description: An article in Metropolitan Report on Monday reported erroneously that the law firm of Finley, Kumble, Wagner, Heine, Underberg & Grutman had been retained by BusTop Shelter Inc. The firm changed its name in October 1976  when Norman Roy Grutman and Jewel Grutman resigned  to Finley, Kumble, Wagner, Heine& Underberg.

title: Personal Health
description: GROWING thousands of Americans have been told or have convinced themselves that they have a disease that, in fact, doesn't exist. The disease is hypoglycemia, literally low blood sugar, which isn't a disease at all but a possible sign of a number of different underlying health problems.

title: Productivity Up 1.1% in 1978
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (UPI) Productivity in nonfinancial corporations increased 1.1 percent in 1978, the Labor Department reported today. Its Bureau of Labor Statistics said the rise In output per worKerflour reflected 5.4 percent increase in output and a 9.2 percent rise in employee hours.

title: A Defense of English Food Some of It, Anyway
description: EAST HAMPTON, L.I. FOR years the food of Britain has been greeted with a mixture of humor or derision and sometimes with a combination of both. There is indeed something whimsical about foods called toad in the hole and tbubble and squeak and sausages dubbed bangers. It is also true that the humble Brussels sprout generally overcooked  has been referred to as the national vegetable and also as British caviar.

title: Knicks Conquer Warriors
description: Two free throws by Toby Knight with 11 seconds remaining last night gave the Knicks a 10199 victory over the Golden State Warriors at Madison Square Garden. The crowd of 9.376 was the smallest for a Knicks game since the building opened in February 1968. Included in that count were the 8,710 seats belonging to seasonticket holders, many of which were empty.

title: Former City Hall Official Upsets Daley Successor in Close Contest
description: CHICAGO, Wednesday, Feb. 28  Jane M. Byrne, a regular turned maverick, upset Mayor Michael A. Bilandic and the city's Democratic machine in yesterday's mayoral primary election.

title: Carol Robinson, 89, a Pianist; Began Her Career in the 1920's
description: Carol Robinson, a pianist who appeared with several American orchestras and was a participant in a number of modernmusic performances over more than two decades beginning in the 1920's, died Monday at Doctors Hospital. She was 89 years old.

title: Market Place
description: POLAROID'S disappointing quarterly earnings report last Thursday contrasted sharply with the results of rival Eastman Kodak, which reported dramatically improved figures for the fourth quarter.

title: Chess
description: SAO PAULO, Feb. 26  A last round strewn with errors produced a tie for first place between Viktor Korchnoi of Switzerland and Ljubomir Ljubojevic of Yugoslavia in the Sao Paulo International Tournament in the Clube De Xadrez. Each scored 103.

title: Q&A
description: Q. A friend of mine always puts salt cellars and pepper mills on the table when she entertains. I don't. Is it not insulting to alter somebody's carefully contrived food by adding either one or both?

title: New Yorkers, etc.
description: FAMILIARITY breeds contempt, and by the advent of March people tend to have lost their awe of winter. Eyes fixed on the coming of spring like exhausted runners staggering toward a finish line, they are prone to be overtaken, astonished and crushed by the varied fury cif March weather.

title: Pan American
description: The keystone of the case for a Pan American World AirwaysNational merger is more vigorous competition and lower fares.

title: Capital Police Shut Mall To Vehicles of Farmers
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27 (AP)  The police gave protesting farmers a deadline of midnight tomorrow to remove their tractors and campers from the Mall, the grassy area between the Capitol and the Lincoln Memorial on which the farmers have been camped for three weeks.

title: EARNINGS
description: The American Broadcasting Companies Inc., which has disposed of its movietheater operations and is getting out of the recordedmusic business. yesterday reported profit gains of 30.7 percent for the that quarter of 1978 and 23.5 percent for the full year. Earnings and revenues for both periods set company records.

title: Korchnoi Defeats Karpov As Chess Player of 1978
description: PARIS, Feb. 27 (Agence FrancePresse)  Viktor Korchnoi was given some consolation for his defeat at the hands of the Soviet Union's Anatoly Karoov in last vears's world chess championship when he was named Chess Player of the Year for 1978 by a worldwide association of chess writers today. He received 707 points in the voting, and Mr. Karpov received 689.

title: Connecticut Bonds Sell Sluggishly
description: Connecticut sold $125 million of highgrade taxexempt bonds yesterday that were priced to yield perhaps onetenth of 1 percent more than they would have been last week, but the increased yield did not make investors scramble to buy. The bonds sold slowly, and $70 million remained in underwriters inventories at the end of the day.

title: STUDY ON SACCHARIN SAID TO SEEK CURBS, IN U.S. BUT NOT BAN
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  A longawaited report on saccharin by the National Academy of Sciences will not recommend a ban on the artificial sweetener but will seek to restrict its use, particularly among children, according to scientists familiar with the report.

title: Cello: Bach by Olefsky
description: ONE hates to quibble about Paul Olefsky'' recital Monday night at Carnegie Recital Hall. Mr. Olefsky is a distinguished cellist, and his program consisted of Bach's six suites for cello solo, an undertaking that inspires more than a little admiration and respect. The playing, moreover, was on a high level throughout the evening.

title: Iranian City Torn by a Scrarnble for Power
description: TABRIZ, Iran, Feb. 27  Early this morning young members of the Islamic militia took a halfdozen Centurion tanks out of the large, nearly empty military base in this provincial capital for a practice drive. They gunned them through the city streets, lurching about with such force and noise that the tanks seemed ready to shatter.

title: Suspect in $60 Contract Murder Captured in Leap From Window
description: CLEVELAND, Feb. 27 (AP)  A youth accused of accepting $60 from two teenagers to kill their father was captured after he leaped from a secondstory window and tried to escape, the authorities said.

title: Limited Bank Plan Is Backed
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  The Carter Administration has declined to endorse consolidation of the nation's bank regulatory agencies into a single commission and will support instead a far more limited proposal, according to senior Administration officials.

title: Tool Orders Up in January
description: New orders for machine tools manufactured in the United States were 65 percent above yearago levels last month, the National Machine Tool Builders Association reported yesterday

title: JOAN E. SN ELLING
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Feb. 27 (AP)  Joan E. Snelling, who helped develop Snelling and Snelling Inc., an employment service, died of cancer yesterday. She was 46 years old.

title: Norman H. Tamoff, Executive In I.B.M. International Division
description: Norman H. Tarnoff, manager of the general computer systems plans and support of the International Business Machines Corporation's General Business Group/International Division, died Saturday at White Plains Hospital after short illness. He was 50 years old, and had homes in White Plains and New Milford, Conn.

title: Sweepstakes Season: Offers Proliferate
description: Open the mailbox and pull out a dream: An income for life . . . No purchase necessary . . . You may be a winner already . . . .

title: 6 County Executives Echo Mayors' Complaints
description: Reciting a catalogue of problems strikingly similar to those voiced by bigcity mayors, the chief executives of six suburban counties surrounding New York City say that they foresee a period of no growth in the government operations they direct and, in some cases, the likelihood that they will have to discharge employees to avoid increasing taxes.

title: Careers
description: JOB opportunities are so often tied to economic or business trends that it is surprising that more students danot study economics. Even so, few economics courses delve deeply into commodityfutures trading, one of the fastestgrowing business areas.

title: News Summary
description: WEDNESDAY, FEBRUARY 28, 1979

title: Iran's Oil Chief Confident
description: TEHERAN, Iran, Feb. 27  After two days in the rich oilfields in southwestern Iran, the man the new regime chose to get the valves wide open again returned here tonight, apparently confident that exports would begin the first of next week, that the nation could command an oil price considerably higher than any other country and that he had sufficiently pacified the 65,000 oil workers, whose allegiance was in doubt.

title: Advertising
description: ADD one to the growing list of media schemes for reaching rich people: a superslick magazine called Symbol.

title: Governors Win Senate Panel's Support on Aid Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Feb. 27  The nation's governors, worried that Congress might seek to punish states for their apptals for a balanced Federal budget, scored a small victory today after intense lobbying when the Senate Finance Committee recommended that revenue sharing be continued at present levels in the fiscal year beginning Oct. 1.

title: Article 2 -- No Title
description: advertisers are actually sponsors of programs.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: President Carter said it was important for Congress to give him the authority to impose measures t o conserve oil, but he did not commit himself to invoice the measures despite the prospect of a serious shortage. In a news conference, the President also expressed the belief that the new Government of Iran intends to rebuild its oil production and can resume oil exports s oon. Meanwhile, the Energy Department said mandatory conservation measures would be imposed only if a 15 percent shortage developed in oil supplies. The shortage currently is 2.5 percent. [Page Al.)

title: World Oil Output Increased 1% in '78
description: Although Iranian oil production started dropping during the last quarter of 1978, crude oil production worldwide rose 1 percent last year to a record 60.3 million barrels a day, according to the current issue of Oil & Gas Journal.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: I WAS recently driving around town, apartmenthunting, and admittedly slightly preoccupied, writes Sharon Ostopowitz. Thus, when a car in front of me came to a surprising short stop at a red light, I ran into it, lightly touching bumpers

title: Canada G.N.P. Rose 3.4% in 78
description: OTTAWA, Feb. 27 (Reuters)  The Canadian economy grew by 3.4 percent in 1978, up from 2.7 percent in 1977 but well short of the Government's initial target of 5 percent, Statistics Canada reported today.

title: Orioles AAA Farm Team Ousts General Manager
description: ROCHESTER, N.Y., Feb. 27 (UPI)  Don Labruzzo was dismissed today as general manager of the International League's Rochester Red Wings and Bob Drew was appointed as acting general manager of the team, the Baltimore Orioles Class AAA farm club.

title: Bell System Bond Yield Is 9.66%, Peak Since '75
description: A $250 million issue of Bell System bends was priced yesterday to yield 9.66 percent  the highest rate in almost three and a half years. Much to the relief of Wall Street, investors did not snub the offering but bought all the bonds by midafternoon.

title: On Eve of Vote, Scots Seem Divided on Home Rule
description: GLASGOW, Feb. 27  For the proud and turbulent people of Scotland, Thursday will be the most significant day politically since 1707, when they joined with the English in the Act of Union that created Great Britain.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: I'LL have to admit I was held by the autobiography that Tabor Hill unfolds in Richard Kiuger's latest novel, Star Witness  about a lawyer whose familiar problem it is that she has to prove herself superior to be accepted as equal, but once ac

title: Sports Today
description: BASKETBALL

title: World News Briefs
description: NEW DELHI, Feb,. 27  Sanjay Gandhi, son of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, was sentenced to two years of hard labor today for his role in the theft and destruction of a film that had caricatured his mother's Government.

title: Private Lives
description: WHEN he was 11 years old, in Washington, D.C., he had shaken the hand of Senator Joseph R. McCarthy. He had not approved of Senator McCarthy  he owned, in fact, a WIN WITH KEFAUVER Tshirt  but he wasn't yet old enough to have decided that there are certain hands one doesn't shake. When you were introduced to somebody, you shook his hand, regardless. In the 1960's, of course, there were so many hands one wasn't allowed to shake that the average social occasion resembled a convention of telephone poles; people stood in solitary indignation at the opposite ends of dinner parties and hummed at one another.

title: People's Temple Member Facing Murder Charges in Guyana Today
description: GEORGETOWN, Guyana, Feb. 27 (UPI)  After two delays and an abortive attempt at pleabargaining, Larry Layton will face a jury tomorrow on charges that he killed Representative Leo J. Ryan and four other persons.

title: Oil Prices Continue To Rise
description: Prices continued to rise on the world oil market yesterday, with the increases spreading outside the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries to other producers. But Saudi Arabia, Iraq and Mexico all said they nlarmed to hold the line.

title: Motorists Finding Few Gas Shortages
description: Despite the loss of oil supplies from Iran and the series of announcements by oil companies that they must reduce gasoline deliveries to their dealers, motorists have so far encountered few shortages, a nationwide check by The New York Times has shown.

title: Recital: Barbosa, Pianist
description: IN his latest New York recital, in Alice Tully Hall on Monday night, Antonio Barbosa divided his program neatly into two formal sonatas played before intermission and a series of highly Romantic works played afterward. The Brazilian pianist, appearing as part of a Salute to Brazil, tackled the two styles of music with an appropriate difference.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: DETROIT, Feb. 27 (AP)  The Mexican operations of the General Motors Corporation will be doubled in size by 1982 under an expansion program announced today by the auto maker.

title: Corporate Earnings Are Reported for the Quarter
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed an the New York Stock Exchance,(Al the American Stock Ex. change and (O)Osecthecounter.

title: State May Lose Major U.S. Aid On Water Plans
description: ALBANY, Feb. 27  New York State is on the verge of losing up to $200 million in Federal assistance for waterpollution control projects because it has been unable to assemble enough applications to qualify for the aid. Most of the loss, officials said, would be suffered by New York City.

title: Bomb Mailed to a Priest Hurts Detective in Blast
description: MILWAUKEE, Feb. 27 (AP)  A bomb in a book mailed to a Roman Catholic priest who has written for a Croatianlanguage newspaper exploded outside a parochial elementary school yesterday, injuring a police detective who was trying to remove it, the authorities said

title: John J. Clancy, at 78; Port Authority Official
description: John J. Clancy, former Commissioner of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, died Monday at the Hospital Center in Orange. N.J. He was 78 years old and lived in Short Hills, N.J.

title: Indiana State Wins 27th in Row
description: TERRE HAUTE, Ind., Feb. 27 (AP)  Larry Bird scored 29 points and pulled down 15 rebounds tonight as unbeaten Indiana State defeated West Texas State, 9484, in the first round of the Missouri Valley Conference basketball tournament. Earlier today, the Sycamores were ranked first in both the coaches and writers polls for the first time.

title: Met Plans New Stagings Of Four Operas in 7980
description: The Metropolitan Opera will present four new productions during the 197980 season, it was announced yesterday at a press conference Among those present were Anthony A. Bliss, executive director; James Levine, music director, and Joan Ingpen, artistic administration.

title: Use of HigherSulfur Oil Allowed For 30 Days by New York State
description: Because of a shortage of oil, New York State has allowed the emergency distribution of fuel for homes and industry with a sulfur content above the legal limit that bad been set to protect air quality.

title: Randers Miss 3 Stars and Lose to Blues, 41
description: ST.LOUIS, Feb. 27  There was not much checking at the Checkerdome tonight, at least not on the Rangers part. New York lost, 41, to the St. Louis Blues, a team that has won only 14 games.
